Reviews.Title: “Not so much............”
Reviews.Author: cindy b
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet and the king bed was comfortable, however, is a tired hotel needing renovation and a deep cleaning. Pool was fine for our needs- was sunny day and the beer is reasonably priced. Don't sit in the sports bar and gamble if you want to drink because they won't wait on you- extremely poor service, borderline rude- all three days we tried. Front desk staff nice, helpful and accomodating. (maybe they should trade jobs!)

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicki L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decide to go to Vegas at the last minute and there were no rooms available. We called our AAA travel agent who hooked us up with the room at Hooters. Since we were last minute travelers, and Vegas was booked, I can safely say we overpaid for this room. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere casual (it is a Hooters afterall). We were in an Ocean Tower room...don't get excited. The Ocean Tower overlooks the pool area, and the airport. If you like to watch airplanes land this is the view for you. The pool area appeared to be small, but it had a nice waterfall area, and jacuzzi. There is even a sand box. The room is nothing more than a basic hotel room and it is in need of a remodel. It was clean and the bed comfy. The bare basics in the room for shampoo and body lotion and the towels were really rough. All I am saying this room is worth about $100.00 a night, and it probably suits well the younger crowd. It is walking distance to the Tropicana and MGM. The location is great. We had fun in their casino...the table limits were very reasonable. That is a bonus for those that want to gamble on a smaller budget. It was a fun trip and this served our purpose for our last minute road trip. If you are looking for a casual place, Hooters fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Britleo
Reviews.Content: Low cost and it shows, but if you just want a cheap room and to experience the Hooters style then fine. Could do with some basic renovations and it is showing its age. Pool is in the dark most of the afternoon, unless you keep moving around assuming not many other people are using the loungers. Staff are friendly, beers cheap and the food is reasonably priced. If you can get a deal or are prepared to pay extra, then try the recently refurbished Tropicana next door. You can then just pop next door to try the Hooter's experience. The theme is great, just a shame they couldn't refurbish the place.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again, unhappy.”
Reviews.Author: kickboxchick
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas about three times a year and decided to try a place a little less expensive and had a terrible time here. So I reviewed hooters a while back and was very unhappy with my stay so they sent be a discount code to "give them a second chance". Well there was a problem with the code, almost had to pay full price. The staff was completely rude throughout the entire check in like I was inconveniencing them by being unhappy with THEIR offer not working, overall id rather stay at circus circus than stay here again. (which isn't saying much)

Reviews.Title: “Service the customer”
Reviews.Author: rcollette
Reviews.Content: After spending the time to walk over from MGM for what I thought would be a quick drink I instead got to watch the front bar staff chatting with each other. After 5 minutes of being ignored,I left. (today at4pm front bar)

Reviews.Title: “Good value fun times”
Reviews.Author: Bcity
Reviews.Content: The pool is open late and there is a bar. We had an amazingly relaxing evening just chilling near the pool. There was a good mix of people everyone having fun and at same time behaving themselves. We stayed here our first night in Vegas and it was a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Garry660790
Reviews.Content: Great time in Vegas--We were very surprised at all the great things at Hooters--Big clean rooms,great beer prices,over the top friendly staff, added feature is the purchase of a Hooters coffee cup and you get free coffee 24/7(and it is GOOD), and great food to boot! We were on a 2 week vacation and never did move on. The pools were awesome and we really like the smallness of the casino--never once got lost. We will be back. Thanks from Canada!! Special thanks to Antonio(front desk) for all the above + beyond help.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient locatiion”
Reviews.Author: naojyort
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with friends. The casino was great, some cheap tables and also more expensive ones, for those with lots of cash to spend. The staff were lovely and all the punters were really friendly too. There was a real sense of camaraderie between the players as we all tried to beat the dealer. The room was adequate, could do with a bit of modernization, but I didn't spend that much time there :) The food was lovely and reasonable priced. Yummy buffalo wings at 5.30am!!! Hooters was within walking distance to all the bigger hotels and casinos, MGM, Stratosphere etc. I would recommend this hotel for it's value for money, convenience and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but then there is this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Marcella2007
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I stayed for 2 days recently and spent $18.00 per night ($29 total with resort fee) Way to start a Vegas trip!! We arrived at the hotel at about 12:00 am on a Wednesday and the first Gal that we interacted with at the front desk was the coolest person ever! Customer service means the WORLD to us and - She had us at hello! Yes the room was outdated but it was a NICE ROOM!! I really did feel like I was at a resort on the beach. My husband and I have some pretty high standards and I swear - Don't knock Hooters Casino and Hotel, the atmosphere was a fun and fresh start to our Vegas vacation. That’s a lot to say for us approaching 40ish..... We already have people booking there for the summer!! Oh wait – My Husbands only gripe was that the towels were rough! (Thought I’d throw that in! )

Reviews.Title: “I love this Bar...”
Reviews.Author: Kirk M
Reviews.Content: we ate/drank at the front bar while waiting on our flight out of Vegas.. good food and good drinks and CHEAP... bud light is 1.50 all day long... put 20.00 in the bar poker game and they are free... of course there is plenty of eye candy fellas

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: April H
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas last year for the Viva Rockabilly festival over Easter Weekend. A few friends and I stayed here. We were all stunned by how friendly and helpful the staff was all around! Rooms are a little dated but it is Vegas how much time will you really spend in your room? Food was great and cheap same for drinks! Men of X show was perfect for something for us ladies. I won't be staying anywhere else in Vegas because the price and staff. Beds are super comfy too! I'll be going back this April for the festival again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: ebors
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful little hotel - do not expect luxury. A few minutes walk to the recently updated Tropicana and the rest of the Strip, cheap beers and chicken wings. Who could ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Wings have shrunk and the beer is warm”
Reviews.Author: smiller560
Reviews.Content: I know that Hooters is in financial trouble but if you promote $1.50 Bud then it should be cold. Also the wings have shrunk. 9.50 for 10 small wings when you can get them for .25 at midnight that is what they are worth.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location”
Reviews.Author: Yearyinsa
Reviews.Content: Casino a little outdated, rooms were clean, odorless, and comfy. Drinks at casino are some of the best on the strip. It is a little off the strip, but not any further than some of the bigger properties. What I mean is you can leave your room and be standing on the street in 2 min. And then another 3 minute walk and you are standing on LV Blvd. A lot of bigger properties will take 5-10 min to get just from your room to their own casino

Reviews.Title: “Only Year-round Pool & Spa in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: newmexicoonline
Reviews.Content: Hooters was recommended by my son who lives in Vegas, because he knows I am more into the pool and spa than the gambling. There is nothing luxurious about the place, but we went for the pool view bungalow rooms and could walk right out our sliding door and be at the pool area in 10 steps. The bungalows are definitely the way to go if you want to be as close to the pools/spas as possible. They had both spas open and one of the three pools was heated (I judge to about 80 degrees). Since we were there in January, it was warm enough that I jumped in it after some minutes warming up in one of the spas. An added bonus to the bungalow building is that coffee was available 24/7 in the Bait Shop right next to the pool (since they don't have in-room coffee makers). The staff were all friendly, much more so than some other places I've stayed in Vegas. The safe in our room quit working and we had to spend 45 minutes while they repaired it. I would most likely not stay here in the summer when everybody has their pools and spas going, but it's amazing to me that in the middle of winter your only options seem to be Hooters or the Golden Nugget if you want to soak in a spa, let alone jump in the pool! Oh yes, at the time we stayed the internet was free in room, but you had to hook up with an ethernet cable, which didn't reach very far. Oh yeah, the chicken wings at Hooters ARE great, and I thought the food at the Mad Onion was good, too.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bazmc666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in Feb, as a cheap Saturday night stop, quick check in and clean room and corridors, it's a bit shabby round the edges but as rumour has it, it's being sold why would anyone put any money into it! All in all good cheap hotel for partying and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Legit for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Chellie929
Reviews.Content: We ended up here because of the unpublished rate deal on Expedia. We wanted an inexpensive room so we could spend our money on the other things Vegas has to offer. I was not happy however when it finally told us we were going to be staying at Hooters. Everything I read said it was dirty and I was unhappy about the fact that it was off the strip when it said on Expedia that it was on the strip. But they are pretty stuck to their no refunds policy so Hooters it was. The room looks like most hotel rooms...bathroom, bed, tv window. Nothing special but nothing bad. I think some people mistake older for dirty. Nothing in our room was dirty however some things were a bit worn. The bed was actually pretty comfortable. The walls were thin but it really wasn't a problem. We didn't even hear people talking. There was a convenience store downstairs along with a Hooters (of course) and the Mad Onion restaurant. We only ate once at MadOnion for breakfast and it was just fine. The 25 cent wings from 12 am-6am were a nice perk too. Just keep in mind they are 50 cents if you are going to take them up to your room. Still a good bargain. I saw a couple of reviews that talked about the type of people that were in the casino and they were afraid to be there. Seriously? Its not the yuppie crowd but it's hardly a group of derelicts. Everyone we met was very friendly. As for being off the strip, I am still a bit unhappy with Expedia but really you are walking everywhere in Vegas anyway and the walk across to MGM isn't any further than between most other hotels. I wish we had a coffee maker in the room because I'm not a nice person til I have had my coffee and having to go downstairs for gas station coffee or walking over to MGM for Starbucks kind of sucked. The casino was mostly older machines which I kind of like but it's small and we were starting to get tired of playing there by the third night. Once again though it was nice to have a casino in the hotel. Here's the bottom line...I paid $45 a night in Vegas over a weekend. I had a clean, comfortable room with most of the amenities of any other room. I wanted to spend my money on nice restaurants and slot machines and the fact that I paid less for three nights and could have done four for less money than ONE night at MGM made it totally worthwhile. If its your honeymoon or you want to go and not leave your room or hotel I wouldn't recommend it. Otherwise relax, have fun, and enjoy one of the last good values in Vegas. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kharun K
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's not the best hotel in vegas but its FAR from the worst. I have stayed at many upscale hotels on the vegas strip and I always go back to Hooters for the perks and discounts. For as little as you pay you get a very decent and clean room. The staff is very friendly and often you get coupons for free breakfast at the mad onion restaurant, which is located in the hotel/casino. Great food! I have been staying at Hooters mainly for the price and the location. It's right across the street from MGM and next door to the newly remodeled Tropicana. It's also only a 3-5 minute walk to NY NY hotel and its walking distance to the free tram at Excalibur which takes you to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Plus, at Hooters they have 3 dollar black jack all the time and $1.50 beers :)

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: kdpahl
Reviews.Content: Hooter's is definitely inexpensive when it comes to a room in Vegas. The quality and cleanliness is proportionate to the cost. The hotel could use an overhaul starting with the AC units and carpets. If you have allergies, this is not the place for you. I would say that we found the staff very friendly and helpful. They asked why we were not staying for the full length of our trip as we were moving to another casino. The casino staff and hotel staff keep this place open by their service, but they can only do so much with what they have to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bc2437
Reviews.Content: The room was so disgusting that I could not even spend the night. There were stains all over the carpet, it smelled musty/moldy, the bathroom was falling apart (i.e. the floor was missing pieces, the counter was stained, the shower was dirty), and on top of all of this the walls were paper thin! My fiance and I were only there 10 minutes before our neighbors arrived and we could hear their entire conversation. I understand not to expect much at the low rate they offer, but the fact that I couldn't even take my shoes off or was willing to put any of my belongings on the bed was enough to force me out of there. There are far better places to stay in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Raack n Roll Show & Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: nocole1
Reviews.Content: This review is based on the show and restaurant only. Did not stay at the hotel. Raack n Roll show was very bad. There are only 4 girls in the show and they dance to pre-recorded rock music. The comic is semi-funny. Do not waste your money even if you can go for $20. There are plenty other shows in vegas that are much better. Also, the waitress tried to stiff us on change for drinks. Shorted us $10. I do believe it was on purpose!!! I wonder how many other people she did this to that were not paying attention!!!!!!! We called her on it and got our $10. She claimed it was a mistake. I don't think so! Also, we paid for the VIP which included a lame hooters t-shirt (because they were out of the Raack n Roll ones) and a quick picture. They took the picture quick and hurried us on our way. Do not go to this show!!!!! Restaurant: Ordered the fish tacos--- terrible. The side of coleslaw tasted like plain cabbage. I got my meal for free as I complained. I could not even eat it. However, we had to go to the show so I could not get anything else to eat. And just to let you know....I am not one to complain much and pretty much eat anything. The only thing good about this place was the casino...and that's not saying much. It is pretty run down and old. I can only imagine what the rooms are like in the hotel! Don't waste your time or money here no matter how cheap it is. There are so many other great places in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: designbytheyard
Reviews.Content: I like that this is a smaller hotel, It is not fancy. It has kind of a beachy theme and is pretty casual. We have stayed there a few times and often paid only $19.00 for the room.( be careful there is a resort? fee) it is not 2 miles from the front desk to the elevator to your room. The rooms are roomy and clean,. One of my favorite things about this hotel is the pool area. It has a few different pools and being Hooters there are not a lot of yelling children splashing you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here all the time”
Reviews.Author: lovehooters
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a dozen or more times. Never had a dirty room/bathroom or seen bugs of any kind. It's a great value. great location, and I have ALWAYS been treated well (not because of gambling). The casino is small and quaint. Like the bar locations. It tends to be more of an adult crowd as it should be in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down but the staff is good”
Reviews.Author: phadreus
Reviews.Content: This Hotel matches the 30 dollar price tag - but there were ants in the bathtub and its somewhat run down.

Reviews.Title: “Transit”
Reviews.Author: EdenVivian
Reviews.Content: For a name that is suppose to be synomous with beautiful women this hotel is not, I was so disappointed We stayed about everywhere in Vegas and this was the worst. The rooms were dirty, I didn't feel safe, and I couldn’t even go work out. I think this hotel had 4-hour rates if you catch my drift. Anyway at best I would stay here when I was in college on spring break. I'm grown now and it was my Christmas Vacation. Stay at the Monte Carlo if you not looking for a deal at least it clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap decent great location”
Reviews.Author: Desiree1234
Reviews.Content: Im probably not their target market, a 31 year old female (i expected a place my dad would go with his motorcycle friends) but I gotta say for $30 a night, I was pleasantly surprised. It's a casino so it smells casino-y but the check in guy was fast and pleasant, the valet guys are fast and pleasant, room was clean and ready at noon (girls weekend, we arrived early.) I also expected in your face Hooters and nope, it wasnt like that, very tame. The complimentary breakfast at mad onion is awesome too. Im a vegetarian and ordered it no meat and without me even asking for them to do so they subbed a fruit plate. We all felt bad that everything was so cheap! Directly across from MGM too. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters: Unscheduled stay, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: MrCrownRoyalSteve
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank Front Desk Supervisor, Noe Monarrez for listening and understanding my situation during an unscheduled extra night stay in Vegas. I missed my flight because of an airport screening incident regarding my bottle of Crown Royal. I was detained by TSA and Las Vegas Police for having my Crown in my carry-on. After explaining why she was with me, I kissed her goodbye, missed my flight and needed a place to stay for a flight out the next day. An employee of Ellis Island Casino recommended Hooters for their price and location. Upon arriving, I was treated professionally by Mr. Monarrez. He was flexible with my room deposit that allowed me to stay at H00TERS. The hotel rate was surprisingly reasonable for it's location and proximity to the Strip. The newly remodeled rooms were just what I needed for a restful sleep. The staff I made contact with were friendly, courteous and fun, I will highly recommend Hooters Casino Hotel to my family, friends and business clients and look forward to my return visit. Best Regards and see you again soon, <I:-) Mr. Crown Royal Steven Sanchez

Reviews.Title: “Like a half-step up from a Motel 6, with wings and fries”
Reviews.Author: vlotty
Reviews.Content: The Hooters Casino looks exactly like a Hooters restaurant inside. Decor is "delightfully tacky yet unrefined", and feels a bit like a beachfront motel. Rooms and bathrooms are clean enough. For $40 including tax (weeknight), what do you expect? Don't expect a shiny new hotel or casino, everything looks like it was from the 70s. Check-in and check-out take way too long, and the parking elevator looks like an elevator from one of those horror movies where you're in a low-rent NYC apartment building elevator. Plus: It's relatively close to the strip, maybe a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “It's Hooters- what it's fun...”
Reviews.Author: dandog123
Reviews.Content: It's not MGM Grand, it's Hooters. Room was better than Motel 6, it's clean. There are some rough edges, but booking online- it was a cheap place to stay. Lots of fun- close to New York-New York and MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Get Toe”
Reviews.Author: danrodgerson
Reviews.Content: So I hit Hotwire and got the Hooters hotel and Casino. After the glare from the girlfriend I was secretly excited. “Honey, it was hotwire! I did not pick the place the emphasizes boobs!" The entire place was foul. Customer service was horrible. Our room was not ready. Needed to wait 45 minutes and get back into a 45 minute line to get the room key. The rooms were dingy and dirty. Literally stained walls and mold growing in the bathroom. Maybe the average clientele is too drunk to notice. I get the Caribbean theme, but the only thing Caribbean that was represented was that most of the Caribbean is a third world country. The walls were paper thin and you could hear EVERYTHING in the adjacent rooms. Bathrooms was gross. The low 7 foot ceiling coupled with the lack of a fan made me want a shower after my shower. I have stayed in Hostels in South American cleaner and nicer than this place. Whoever rates the hotels and gives out the start, please take a look and downgrade. Mr Hooters, you need some dramatic changes or just stick to wings and breasts.

Reviews.Title: “cheap conveniant location”
Reviews.Author: MrsBeav
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cheap and about a 5 minute walk from the MGM,New York New York on the strip, they also have 25 cent wings late night for hooters card members(Free) !!! The casino is ok but small and the pool is great open 24 hrs! The hotel needs some updating and they need to check on the cleanliness of rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but CHEAP and ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: BennyPL
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hotel beacuse of its location and price. I was my first time in Las Vegas. I was really suprised when checking in I recived 2 coupons for dinner. That made my stay there cheaper than at home ;) Hotel is a good choice for the people who party and spend most of the time on the strip or in casinos. Rooms are clean but not new - you can see there lots of signs that hundreads of people were there before you ;). There is no WIFI Internet but if you carry ethernet cable with you you porbably can use their internet for free (but not sure). But as I mentioned before its a nice place for young people and students who party and enjoy Vegas instead of spending time in room.

Reviews.Title: “it was FUN in a CRAZY sort of way”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: I take my 2 adult children to vegas every year for the super bowl. messed up reservations at NY NY . Wanted to be close to that location so booked Hooters. Rooms were clean hallways also in great shape .Security was all over the place (they had to be) Casino attracted the lower end of the spectrum. It was so funny to see a person playing a penny slot with a six pack of beer at his side.When someone it on either 3 dollar black jack or 50 cent roullet the roar of the crowd would be overwhelming I think if you hit for 10 bucks that was worthy of aload roar. Would we stay hear again ? I don,t think so but it was different, clean , and alot of laughs. OOPs I forgot CHEAP!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING IS WRONG AT HOOTERS!”
Reviews.Author: lapetat
Reviews.Content: I've heard great things about hooters hotel and casino but was so disappointed. One woman who I was playing blackjack with fell asleep while we were playing! I came into contact with one manager (big blonde hair, white, older) and she was the rudest, most unprofessional woman I've ever met. It took us an hour to get our food at hooters, the mad onion kept bringing out burnt food, our room had a open comdom wrapper and mystery brown stuff on the toilet seat, the list goes on and on. Then the icing on the cake was my mom spent about 700 in the casino while I spent over 1000 and she got a comp stay for a future visit and I got nothing! This was the worst experience I've had in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Graet Value”
Reviews.Author: 123rb
Reviews.Content: A friens and I had to spend one night in Las Vegas in October 2011 and I didn't want to spend a lot of money. I found the Hooters Hotel on line and took them up on a great deal - $24 for a double. I expected something taudry but the hotel was clean, the sevice was fine and the Hooters Girls weren't in your face. Actually, for $24 it's a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what I needed”
Reviews.Author: socialboot
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from my room on the 17th floor or the Hooters hotel. I'm sorry that so many of the previous reviews had a bad time here, I certainly am not. I'd dropped by the $3 blackjack table on my last two trips to Vegas and had a good time. I decided to try taking advantage of their winter deal when I knew I'd be back here. When I read some of the reviews below, i was nervous but went forward with it. I'm so glad I did. Check in was quick, I received my deal benefits easily. I love how small the place is. I don't have to walk two miles to get from my room to the front desk, a restaurant, and casino games. Everyone that I have encountered on staff has been very helpful and gracious. It's a bit cold for the pool, but it looks like it's fun in the summer. One of my favorite things to do in Vegas is spend a couple hours in the morning playing $3 blackjack at Hooters. if I came in before noon, I've never had a problem finding a seat and normally am up a few bucks when I walk away. The game staff has been great, helpful, and kind (this morning Bill and Fangsu were great.. the floor manager Joe was also a treat). Last time I stayed in Vegas, I was at the Mirage. Fancy place, but I felt that my room and bathroom were way smaller than the one I'm in right now. Compared to RESORTS, this hotel is probably a three star, but according to Yelp, four stars is "Yay! I'm a fan!" which is definitely true and five means it's as good as it gets. For this price, it is as good as it gets and all of the staff that I have encountered has been great. I'll be back and suggest it to friends. It's a good hotel to hang out, play a little, and check out Vegas. It's right off the strip and my room had a great view of Luxor, Excalibur, New York, and MGM. I think this is an excellent hotel to stay at if you're not being fancy-pants!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel i good location”
Reviews.Author: theellitts
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 7 nts, great hotel in a good location 2 mins walk to strip. good big rooms great pools. with a very good gym. great wings

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: healingsavage
Reviews.Content: this was a surprise find! staff were friendly and helpful rooms very cleana nd location perfet for strip not great for a quick coffee and bagel but go next door to tropicana

Reviews.Title: “Casino was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dubfun
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to try and vist some of the off-strip resorts on our most recent trip to Vegas. Hooters advertised a free steak dinner for out of state patrons who signed up for a players card, so we gave it a try. This is a run down property in need of an update. I can't speak for the hotel rooms, but there were areas in the casino (restrooms in particular) that were dirty and in need of repair. It makes me wonder what you don't see behind the scenes at Hooters restaurants. The free dinner was actually pretty good, but if you want a fun atmosphere on the cheap, and one that's right on the strip, go to Bill's Gambling Saloon. I expected Hooters to be similar, but it is many steps below Bill's. After viewing the casino area of Hooters, I can't imagine staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Danceman2008
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas and decided to try the Hooters Casino for change of pace and, I got to tell you it was the best decision that I have ever made. Check in was no problem, and when I got to my room I was surprised at how nice it was and the view of the pool was great. If you like food, they are great for the price. I am an east coaster so being up early in the morning I was able to get 25¢ wings and $1.50 beers, plus, free wings on Wednesday. Overall I would rate Hooters with 4-1/2 stars. Well worth it and will be back every chance I can get!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Phillip H
Reviews.Content: All in all, a great little hotel that does the job! I would definately recommend Hooters!

Reviews.Title: “SECOND HOME”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: We stay at Hooters quite often, we love the service , the price and mostly the staff. The rooms are very reasonable, and we have never had a problem there. We even stayed there when we got married last year, and had a great time. It is a fun place and we have always been satisfied. You can always pay alot more if you want to go somewhere and get soaked, but that just depends on your expectations, we love Hooters, and have recommended them to many family and friends and will contiune to make it our first choice when we visit vegas which is fairly often, as we live in Havasu and have great mini vacations there. Also all our family and friends from Canada fly into vegas , so it is the perfect spot for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay !”
Reviews.Author: PeterXAus
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel and enjoyed friendly, helpful staff, spacious and clean basic rooms and the vicinity to all the attractions on the Strip . We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: str8shooterjm
Reviews.Content: My stay was a Tuesday thru Sunday. Check in was a snap. BTW Tuesdays are a slow day... Room had a wonderful view in the Ocean view tower facing West looking at the strip. Little helicopter traffic noise with air tours but quiet and clean. Don't expect 4 stars here. You get what you pay for. Only complaint I have is I don't smoke. In or out of the hotel/casino you walk thru a all smoking casino floor. Taxis were always ready outside! Never a wait. Hotel held our bags past checkout till our return to leave for the airport. This place has my vote for return trips. A-

Reviews.Title: “The filthiest, most rundown hotel room I've ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: RobAert
Reviews.Content: Throw-up stains on the floor, a broken closet door, busted bathroom door that looks like a five-year-old tried to putty over it. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice will not again. bed bugs 2nd stay top floor. nice for $29.00 a night like the old motel 6 had prices at 30.00 a night. ust a place to stay. Older hotel good food but bed bugs were not good. they hold $75.00 on cc for deposit but get it back more than 2 nights stay ????? good hooters restaurant service ok nice front desk staff

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive, but good hotel to stay at and while Hooters showed up as a possibility, it had a lot of mixed reviews. I guess in Vegas-style, I took a gamble and booked a room. The casino, while small, was clean and possibly less-smoke filled than other casinos. Check-in was quick and painless. The room was clean as well and a lot larger than expected. Importantly, there was no bad smell like I've encountered at other budget hotels. I thought the heater/air-conditioner was a little loud, but I think that at most hotels I stay at. The bed was comfortable, though the comforter was a tad lumpy. I loved the location: next to the Tropicana and across from the MGM Grand. As far as the bars and restaurants go: Always had good service at the bars. I'm not a fan of domestic beer, but the $1.50 Bud Light Limes were too hard to pass up. The Hooters restaurant is pretty standard Hooters as far as selection and quality. The Mad Onion wasn't that great. Breakfast was average, but dinner wasn't too good in my opinion. It's now Cattleman's Ranch (or something like that), though I'm not sure if it is anything more than a name change. The one thing that was strange was the motion-controlled heater/air-conditioner. It wasn't a problem for me since I was there in November, but I wondered if it would get warm if the air conditioner turned off at night while you were sleeping. Overall it was great. It really exceeded my expectations as I was expecting something just tolerable. The only other place I've stayed at in Vegas was the Ramada, and I much prefer Hooters over the Ramada. I would definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Larry F
Reviews.Content: They call this 'off-strip', but just barely - you are just as close to the action as guests at the MGM right across the street. Yes the place is old and showing it's age, but the rooms are adequate and clean, free parking and internet, friendly staff with prompt attention to issues. Pools and hot tubs open 24/7 even in January (nice.....). Casino is small and smoky but if you don't like it you can be in one of the bigger casinos with a 5 minute walk. (BUT I highly recommend gambling here - a couple hundred bucks of play will get you comped rooms on a future stay.) If you are looking for luxury go somewhere else. I will be back. Ideal for budget-conscious travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: RobWinmar
Reviews.Content: We found this one for $30 (including the resort fee) from Sunday onwards, and took it as a cheap place to base ourselves. We weren't intending to spend too much time in the room anyway. The room was large but quite basic. There was no fridge or microwave and the internet cost extra, which was a bit disappointing after having those provided the previous couple of nights at a motel around the corner. I think the whole idea of a resort fee is dishonest, and the fact every other casino hotel has one doesn't make it any better. On a more positive note, we were able to sleep well on the large, comfortable beds and the bathroom was decent. I was wondering if it would be a bit dodgy, being a Hooters and all, but the people staying there mainly seemed to be others just looking for somewhere cheap to stay. The pool is decent, though it was too cold to use it when we were there. It was also a fairly short walk to the strip, so if you're on a tight budget this place is certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for The Strip”
Reviews.Author: ziggyNottingham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right at the bottom of The Strip, next to MGM, Lexor and New York, New York so it's great for setting off in the morning and working your way up to Stratosphere! A couple of tips: get a taxi from the airport as it works out alot cheaper than getting the shuttle. You can see the hotel from the air-strip (don't worry about the noise, you don't hear it!!!). As you come out of the hotel, turn left and there's a great little 24hr diner which serves the most delicious food with great service. Right next door to the diner is a 24hr liquor store which is handy if you want to avoid hefty bar prices! The hotel's casino is small (compared to the larger hotels) but is very friendly and covers all disciplines (slot machines, tables for Black Jack, Poker etc.) and the bar is the cheapest on The Strip (currently USD 1.50 for a bottle of Bud!). The rooms are large and comfortable although both my rooms didn't have a great view. I say BOTH my rooms because on the second night, the people in the room next door to me decided to have a party and, the following morning, I asked to be moved. I expected to be questioned as to why I wanted to move but I was simply given a new key so I suppose this happens quite frequently. I was quickly allocated a room in a quiet area of the hotel and didn't have any problems again so maybe it's worth requesting a "quiet room" when you check in. The room is big and comfy, the bed is huge and soft and the sheet and towels were clean. The bathroom was large but basic with a very powerful shower. If you don't look too closely at the carpet and the marks and scratches on the doors/walls, you'll be quite happy here. You have to overlook these things for the sake of such a great room rate - brilliant if you're on a budget!! A kettle and drinks facility would be nice but they serve drinks in takeaway cups at the bar so it's not so bad. When I was reading past reviews, I was quite nervous about the fact that smoking is permitted in casino's. I'm a non-smoker and that really bothered me. Don't worry! the larger casinos have this covered and actually smell beautiful - probably due to automated smoke diffusers! Hooters isn't so sophisticated in this respect but it still didn't make your clothes smell by hanging around in the bar/casino so I guess their air-con must be pretty effective. All in all, a great little hotel that does the job! I would definately recommend Hooters!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sdtravelers619
Reviews.Content: Obviously its not the Aria or MGM but its a great hotel if you want to go to vegas on a whim. We have stayed here 2 times when we wanted to go to vegas last minute and once as a connector between idaho. (we live in san diego). For $19/ night plus 2 free drinks, $100 in slot play, 2 free show tickets and 20 free wings you cant beat it.Its not luxuary but great when you just want a place to sleep. PLUS the pool is 24 hours! No other resort has this. Great to swim at 4 in the morning after going out all night. And it is right behind the MGM so you can walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “You will be sorry if you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: easttxgirl
Reviews.Content: Check in was very slow. We stayed one week because the rates were cheap. Both my husband I got sick the first night there. We thought it was an upper resp. infection, so called our Dr back home and she sent us some Z-paks. Took those and we weren't any better. We finally realized that it was the room making us sick! I starting looking, I mean really looking around the room and found hidden filth. Mold under the shower head, filth in the vent just above the toilet, the silk plant next to the bed, under the AC/heater was just filth and mold! I called the front desk and asked to speak to the manager, either wasn't he/she wasn't there or didn't care to take my call. I called the their headquarters in Atlanta and told them about what I had found and that we were sick from the filth and mold, she assured me that the manager would contact us. Ten minutes later there is a knock at the door, 2 twenty something Hooter's security officers came in and very rudely asked us what the problem was. They wanted to see our IDs and wanted us to sign off on a statement that said they had remedied our problem. My husband asked for them to show us their IDs and to sign off on the Qtip swabbings from both vents and of course they refused, we also refused their request. We spent thousands in their casino and they didn't even offer to move us to a cleaner room. I'm sure it wouldn't have been cleaner. I got everything on the gift list at their Players Club because of the points I racked up playing slots. Paid $467 to stay there, got sick, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE! Got home and went to Dr as I was still sick, what I had in the bottom of my lungs was reactive, which means it was not from infection but from an allergic reaction. We moved to The Orleans and it was spotless! See pics of Hooter's filth I uploaded.

Reviews.Title: “ickky”
Reviews.Author: Jeanine D
Reviews.Content: Well you get what you pay for. Ok, if you are just passing through. The beds are saggy, the heater loud and you will need the heater during the winter and coffee at the Bar or store by the pool is awful! I was literally getting up and walking across the parking lot to the Tropicana to have a cup of coffee. The pool is open during the winter, BUT, the water is FREEZING! They say the pump is broken, what that means is there is NO HEAT in pool. ok if you are on a TIGHT budget or 20 y/o.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: billybob11
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was disgusting!!! I found pubic hair in the bathroom and buffalo wing sauces on the sheet. I have pretty low standard for room and this room is the worst I ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like their DISHONESTY”
Reviews.Author: Julia B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad for the price, the rooms are pretty clean, the towels are NOT so clean. Blankets are cheap and it was extremely cold at night. Food is not bad downstairs. HOWEVER, I made reservations through iVegas/Expedia and paid online $69 for two nights on Christmas with special promotion. When we arrived at the registration desk, I was told that there is also $8.50 resort fee per day, although we did not plan to use a resort. There was nothing on expedia or ivegas stating that there was another fee. And, on TOP of that there was a $50.00 deposit - AGAIN iVegas/Expedia never said anything about that. And, of course hotel blamed it on Expedia/iVegas. I was told that I would get my refund on deposit within 3-5 days. Nothing has been refunded to me until today. Nobody likes to be lied to. So, NEVER AGAIN. Next time ONLY MANDALAY BAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: amroid22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and was pleasantly surprised by this find! Checked into the hotel and was greeted by very friendly check in staff. Check in was painless smooth, very quick process, perhaps because my booking was prepaid too. The lifts to the rooms are located at the rear end of the casino. A very clever gimmick, as you might just stop on your way in or out of the hotel, and try your luck at some poker or slots! The room was basic but spacious, was really surprised at the neatness of it. The bedding was a bit out of date. Personally I hate floral or colour bedding and prefer white sheets, but these were clean and fresh. We had an amazing view of the strip and the location of the hotel was not bad, about a 10 minute walk to the strip. The Hooters restaurant was not that great, but Hooters is always kind of hit or miss so that was not a train smash. All in all, a great experience at the Hooters Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a limited budget as it provides cheap rates, good rooms and great service!

Reviews.Title: “One night at Hooters”
Reviews.Author: TCrawford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hooters on December 17, 2011. We stayed in the Ocean Tower, room 1534. The room was really cool, without the table and chairs as seen in pictures though. We had asked for a king bed, but upon check-in, around 1:00 P.M., the king wasn't ready and we were offered a two-queen room immediately, which we took. I have to say the check-in staff were friendly and very helpful. The view of the was nice and the windows opened slightly for fresh air. The casino is small and easy to navaigate. The cocktail service was non-existant. My wife played a slot machine for about an hour without one offer of a drink. However, the bar by the front entrance had excellent service and Bud Light Beer for $1.50. Easy to buy others a round at that price. The dealers at the tables were friendly, except the craps table. Although, craps tables dealers tend to be crabby. We saw Raack-n-Roll. Wow! Totally horrible, we actually walked out due to the show and lack of cocktail service. We then went to Tropicana to see Eye Candy, a burlesque show, and I was totally amazed with the show. The best dancing I have seen at a burlesque show in Vegas. We ate a the Mad Onion restaurant, the complimentary steak dinner. The steak was okay and the price was right. Service their was actually pretty good. Checking my play at the end of the trip was pleasant. The staff at the players club were nice and informed me that I had enough play for a coffee mug - meh. Asked If could have a t-shirt instead, and she told me that I qualified for the t-shirt, hat, and mug! Side note, made a bet at the sports book - the dude was really rude, won my bet and did not tip. The guy wears a UNLV Rebels red hoodie and needs to take a class in service and personality development. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place where in Dec. the spa/hot-tub was open 24/7...”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Overall, we really liked Hooters (I never thought my wife would agree to stay there, but... it was $12.50 a night plus 7.50 "resort" fee - so how could we go wrong? - on a Thur. night) We actually stayed there 2 Thursday nights - one passing through from CA and another Thursday passing back. So we chose to stay there a 2nd time so that should tell you something. The "decor" was beach-font hotel, the ambiance was... "sexy." (I mean, it's Hooters, right?) Don't expect 5 Star, but it's clean, needs a bit of work in places, but clean, and the beds were comfortable. Our second night, we got an upgrade to a "Strip View" on the 16th floor. (No, just because it's "Hooters" doesn't mean it's THAT kind of strip - I mean of the lights along the main drag) and for less than 20 bucks we also got 2 steak dinners, a "Hooters" plastic coffee mug (You can't expect "real" ceramic mugs at Hooters can you? lol) some comp slot play that I lost in 10 minutes, and... oh, a Hooters pen and "No Knockers" door sign... What? I wasn't supposed to take those? The pool/jacuzzi area is the only one we saw in town open 24/7 in the middle of the winter - a definite plus for us, as that's what we like. And the water in the jacuzzi (actually two of them) was pristine - not all scummy-foam like we find all too often. I wish every casino had a no smoking section - tired of smelling like tobacco at the end of a night. It's a fun place with a sexy-beachfront (in the desert???) theme. Best deal we could find overall, and not a bummer when we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: waimee
Reviews.Content: I actually enjoyed my stay here. I was hesitant at first, because of the reviews, but I'm glad I stayed. The price was right, "$20 a night plus two steak dinners." I stayed by myself so I had dinner free for both days. The rooms were older with a 27" tube TV, but the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I did not see anyone smoking in the hallways of the no smoking floors as was posted earlier. If there was I would report it since its a non smoking floor. The casino was small, but it wasn't like you couldn't find a machine to use. The waitresses came by a decent amount of times while you played. It wasn't too smokey inside. The staff was very nice and helpful. The Mad Onion didn't have the best tasting food, but the staff was friendly. The bud's were only $1.50. Chicken wings .25 ea after midnight! All in all, if I go by myself, this is the place to stay. If you're taking a wife/girlfriend then I think they'd rather be somewhere a little more pricier.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar - but really cheap”
Reviews.Author: mauiboundLynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hooters casino because we had a 6AM flight the next day and wanted something really close to the airport. It even included a free steak dinner (which was worth every penny but no more). We got a really good deal online so we tried it out. So I struggle to decide how many stars - for the price it was probably excellent. However, the rooms were no better than the cheapest motel, everything seemed very old. But maybe that was on purpose - for the country charm? Maybe I just didn't get it. We ended up wlaking next door to the Tropicana - no that's a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not very good”
Reviews.Author: Machiko-0701
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend in Sep. When we checked in, we needed to wait very long time because they couldn't find our names which was pretty disappointing. But the good thing was the front desk also did her best and she put us upgraded room which was very nice. Price was very good too!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable rooms....”
Reviews.Author: coloradojentravels
Reviews.Content: Got a decent deal to stay at Hooters. Dont forget there's a resort fee, I think about $7/night, not too bad. The staff is very pleasant, they have great food/drink offers BUT the room I stayed in was not very clean. Ive only stayed there ONE time so perhaps I caught it on a bad day... I felt like the hotel elevator, hallway and room could use an extensive cleaning. That could be the rowdy crowd that stays in the hotel.... Pool area was smaller but impressive, and I loved the pool. Very close vicinity to the strip...right next to it. Close to airport, close to food/shopping. Great location....

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: Cfeezell
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I came to Vegas on the spur of the moment for my birthday. We were excited to find such cheap rooms and with the holidays around the corner it was perfect. With that being said, we were not expecting some grande hotel. Really just somewhere to lay our heads at at night. When we first arrived we pulled up to valet, after them looking at us for 3 minutes they finally come to the door and I ask them if they take the bags or if we should take the bags ourselves their response was "depends what you give us". After having an awkward chuckle I had to ask if they were being serious, when I gave them the tip he counted it right in front if me. When we finally got in to check in the girl at the front desk was not only rude but had an attitude every time we had a question, and didnt even ask why we were in Vegas or if we were celebrating any occasions. When we were leaving the valet was on his way back from another car clearly sees us standing there and goes into the office and was in there for 7 minutes while leaving us in the cold until he was ready. We also had to wait numerous occasions to get a cab, where were the people that call the cabs over? Like I said I wasnt expecting very much from this place but it lacks the common customer service any business should have. Highly unsatisfied and would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: FatallyLost
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for my first time. I usually stay at places like this, or Excalibur. It was fine. Nothing spectacular, but, getting away for a couple days was great! Also didn't hurt that it was only $15 a night. Only real complaint, and it's just a nitpick. But, this was the first place I've ever stayed where there wasn't one of the do not disturb door hangers already in my room. I planned on getting up early, but, still, what's that about?

Reviews.Title: “An OK place for one night”
Reviews.Author: Liz730053
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel directly & they would not let us book just 1 night so I went through Travelocity to book it instead . Cost $45. Not bad for a Sat. night check in. We arrived at 10 am & the front desk let us check into an upgraded room right away for an extra $10. Very pleasant & staff were polite & helpful. We signed up at the promotion desk & each received a $200 slot credit (on selected machines) & a free steak supper. The casino floor is small but there was enough machines to play. Easy walking to MGM & other attractions on the strip. Free indoor car park. The room was clean and spacious. The bed was just average & we had neighbors that liked to party so a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more..”
Reviews.Author: Aaron G
Reviews.Content: You really cant complain about a hotel when you get a room for 20.00 a night in las vegas walking distance to all the major resorts and casinos. You seriously dont need to leave here though if your looking to gamble, drink, and get great service. Staff were all super friendly, room was clean, overall great place to stay. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “managment sucked”
Reviews.Author: shamell25
Reviews.Content: the reason why i choose hooters i stayed there before and the service was great it was an african american girl there named kristy and a nother girl there name sara at the front desk they were so nice but i guess that is where the customer service stopped when i arrived at the hotel it was horrible check in process was very rude the girls at the counter would start speaking spanish in front of me laughing i think that was very rude the guy noe and the stone head guy tall think he was the manager very rude and demeaning I can honestly say the reservation manager was great more helpful then the director of the hotel she came to me smelling like a big ball of smoke didnt want to compisate me for the bed bugs that crawled all over me and my daughters leg houskeeping manager mary was a complete b*&tch she needs to be at the motel 6 next door. on the other hand the cage lady i think her name started with a d african american she was so nice. lets not talk about the food ghetto service food cold and nasty the manager was very rude i will never stay at hooters again i had the worst possible stay there ever and one of the maids called me white trash

Reviews.Title: “Don't use the internet kiosk”
Reviews.Author: auburnDeerPark_Ny
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews, that the rooms are average and clean. My only complant is not with the hotel, but with the internet concession kiosk. While attempting to print out my airline boarding pass (after paying $10.00) this antique computer stopped working. Numerious calls to the kiosk customer service requesting a refund were never returned. Fortunatly, Hooters upper management (thank you Mr Jones) agreed with my complant and refunded my money.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: racefan92307
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night before we flew out to vivist our new grand baby. It was cheap to stay but then you get what you pay for. It was very smokey in the casino and smeeled like it thru out the hall ways. parking area was dirty and lacked maintance such as paint and the doors to the elevator could have been painted. maybe i'm a little critical as i manage a business for a living and look at a business as i come in to it.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK place to stay if you just want a bed to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: kervin0819
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic and minimal. I saw that one person wrote it was like a "motel 6" as far as accomodations and I have to agree. It was clean and functional but nothing there that draws you to stay there. While it served our purpose this past weekend, I probably would not stay there again. Bud products are $1.50 which is great! $3 minimum blackjack was great as well, although there is only one table like this and there is always a standing crowd waiting to grab a seat. We ate in the Hooter's restaurant there and the food was not good. We were a party of 6 and not one of us enjoyed the meal nor finished our meals. It is definitely an older motel that has had minimal remodeling. The stuffing has come loose in the bed's comforter so it is all bunched up at the bottom so there is no warmth from it. It is basically just like a second sheet. We never did ask for a blanket (which there are none in the rooms) as we didn't think about it until we were ready to go to bed each night. The registration was very slowly. They are very nice, but slow. Also they are not knowledgeable about the area. We asked a couple of questions about the strip and none of the reservationists knew much about it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Accommodations, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: richard_traveler
Reviews.Content: OK most anyone would say I stayed at Hooters because of the lovely girls flitting through the casino, but hey this is Vegas and its the same way everywhere. What I got was a laid-back vibe, a nice alternative to the glitz of the big hotels. Kind of a Margarita-ville scene. The room was fine, large, comfortable. A bit towards the low-end, but all was adequate. Its across the street from the MGM Grand -- plenty of places to eat there, plus that's the terminus of the monorail which goes all the way to the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Marc C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hooters Hotel and Casino on a couple of occasions when attending events in Vegas. All in all, I am satisfied with my experience. The last time I visited I paid under $300 for six nights by booking in advance. That's hard to beat anywhere. They do charge a resort fee but, I've found that pretty standard in most Vegas hotels. The hotel is older and a bit worn around the edges. Think an older Comfort Inn/Motel 6... I have found that it is generally clean and the staff is helpful. The beds are comfortable, the water pressure is ok and the AC works. I don't know that I'd bring my wife there but, it's ok for traveling alone. You really can't ask for much more than that at the prices that they charge. The location is great: directly across the street from the MGM Grand, next door to the Flamingo and maybe a 5 minute walk to the strip. I agree with the previous reviews about the parking garage. It really is a dump. However, there is an ample sized parking lot and I never had a problem finding a space. I decided not to stay there during my most recent visit to Vegas as they filed chapter 11 bankruptcy in early August. I did stop by for the $1.50 beer and wings and didn't note any significant changes. I hope that they make it. It is a well located, decent, affordable option.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: mr_caroline
Reviews.Content: Hooters hotel should definately not be overlooked when booking your holiday to Vegas. It is off the strip, but only by perhaps a five minute walk (it is no further back than the back rooms of the MGM Grand). Hooters is close to the airport, you don't hear any noise from the planes and you get the benefit that cab drivers can't rip you off taking you round on the freeway to your hotel! Check in was easy, we didn't queue and the reservationist who checked us in really was fantastic - a credit to the hotel. We were upgraded to the next category up so we had a view of the pool and the mountains behind. Everything was spotless, nothing broken, bathroom amenities provided each day. The beds (twin doubles) were comfy with quite lightweight bedding. The hotel is small, which in my mind is a plus - you don't want to walk for ages (and usually in circles) to get back to your room. The casino is small, but the players club has really good deals - wings for 25 cents. In my opinion this is the perfect family hotel. Its laid back, comfortable and completely hassle free. I actually can't stress enough how good I think this hotel is for the amount of $15 per night!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price!”
Reviews.Author: theeshopper
Reviews.Content: I was nervous aboutbringing my young daughter to Hooters Hotel but it was great. California surf theme and comfortable accomodations. I probably would not ever have stayed here were it not for the incredible midweek price, and was pleased at the value. Its a minimal hotel, but we just needed a comfortable bed in an easy to get to location. The only complaint was that we had to go through the smoky casino to get to the room... No other way around. For a family travelling together this was enought to have me knock off one star.

Reviews.Title: “Fun little place just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: vegasjayone
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nice little hideaways away from the strip. 1/2 NL poker, and 9.99 prime rib are what keep me coming here, and I can't complain about the $1.50 beer at the casino bars. Sure it's not a 5 star hotel, but it's got a 5 star heart. It used to be the San Remo a few years ago, then Hooters bought them over. It's a throback to the classic Vegas. Best place here is Pete's Poker Room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay, nice atmosphere, great room”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_Cl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, not even aware of the fact that Hooters was famous for "Hooter girls". I was a bit worried when I found, but it turned out to be fine and the staff was actually very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is definitely not the best in in Las Vegas, but it was cheap, it has very decent cocktails and a sizeable pool which we enjoyed during the blistering heat of summer. The room was huge (at least in our opinion), very well-kept and the bathroom was as clean as could be. We were on the second floor, right around the pool area and were quite worried we'd experience noise and wouldn't be able to sleep but that wasn't the case at all. Room was quiet and the beds very comfortable. The food served in the restaurants - as expected - isn't the greatest, but it was good enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters, la Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ottawakolumbus
Reviews.Content: nice small resort with good pools, whirlpool, nice Florida theme rooms but maybe noisy cause of intrusive huge outside a/c unit, I had to use earplugs all night. Cute girls around the bar and BAD food(just the standard junk)Otherwise the price was amazing at about $42/night, paking free.recomend to budget minded people only.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Chearful with Midnight Wings!”
Reviews.Author: Richr22
Reviews.Content: Been to the Hooters Hotel twice, never feel cheated! The Hotel is so cheap you find it hard to complain, bedrooms were both comfortable and the beds were great. Did see the strangest thing, a queue right round the hotel at midnight for 25cent wings, a bit weird that many people want to eat wings at midnight, (saying that I went for the 911 wings and yes they were hot). Overall cheap and cheerful, but what are people expecting for the price. Its somewhere to go with mates rather than taking the lady!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE..”
Reviews.Author: angelica f
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not the best in Las Vegas, i must say the staff here at Hooters Hotels makes up for it. Not too many people at the front desk knew what they were doing but NOE would always come and save the day..JENN VEG was one of the nicest hotel clerks i have had an experience with in Vegas ever and my husband and i come to vegas very often. i really appereciate those two making our stay pleasant!!!!! THANKS AGAIN NOE AND JENN VEG

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Skurvy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer. This is a older casino and hotel and it shows. When we checked in they up graded us to a high floor strip view. The halls were very dirty and the floors were covered in stains. As we walked towards the room we were kind of worried that maybe we should have payed a little more then $25 a night. When we opened the door we were really surprised. The room was very clean and bed was really nice. We did find out that night that they had to shut off the water to our tower for about 6 hours. They did waive our resort fee for the 5 nights we were there for the trouble. Also the a/c in room was not the greatest, it kept the room some what comfortable but the room was never really cool and it was pretty loud.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters: you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BillyBorracho
Reviews.Content: Check in on a monday night was fast and the girl at the desk was friendly. There is a $50 deposit and a "resort fee" of $8.95 but when my double room is $60 for two nights I'm not complaining about 8 bucks! The room is absolutely no frills. There is all of the amenities of a Motel 6 at half the price. Not a room to bring girls back to, this hotel is for single guys on a budget to have a cheap home base just a short walk from MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters? sorry i meant looters............”
Reviews.Author: Danny D
Reviews.Content: My terrible review on this hotel is purely based on what happened at check out . Check in was great , rooms a little dated but for what we paid i suppose it was a bargain ! Bar staff miserable as sin , quiet , no atmosphere etc. Ok down to the check in, basically she was bubbly and friendly . She took 100 dollars cash per room for 3 rooms as a deposit .We just took the paperwork , signed it ,at handed it back and went off to quickly get changed at hit vegas after a 11 hour flight from the u.k. . On check out we where only handed back 50 dollars per room . Upon challenging this we asked to see the paperwork and it showed we had only paid 50 per room !! We did not at all. It is clear here there is a scam going on , the man dealing with this did not want to know . He had an answer for everything i threw at him . I explained if there was a mistake with the amounts paid then the tills should be up? Can you get i in contact with the girll who checked us in ? sorry her cell is off! look at the security cameras ? sorry , we can see your paying cash on the cameras but its not clear enough ! I was there for a good 20 minutes arguing with this guy ,no joy ! There is a lesson here i suppose but can only recommend to pay with a card and check and keep a copy of the check in paperwork . Or do what i did and go and stay somewhere else ! the choice is endless ! Danny Denson,England.

Reviews.Title: “For $38 a Night was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: denisefromCA_AZ
Reviews.Content: I was flying into Vegas and on to other destinations so I picked this hotel. I was worried about bed bugs with the price being so cheap but I had nothing to worry about, it was not fancy at all but clean so it was all good. A round of drinks are more than a night's stay at this hotel. The bed was comfortable and the shower was clean, what more can one expect at this price?

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better...and worse!”
Reviews.Author: spankyredhead
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home from a week's holiday in fabulous Las Vegas, staying at Hooters hotel and casino. If you're looking for a hotel that's close to the airport, close to the Strip and has comfy beds, great showers and lots of room then Hooters should suit you just fine. It's right opposite the MGM Grand and I felt very safe walking there from the Strip every night. It's a bit grubby round the edges and the staff on the check-in desk can be less than chatty, but if you want elegance and sophistication,try the Bellagio down the road! An uber-chic hotel this ain't, but there's a great party atmosphere and pool is lovely with lots of sun loungers. Good value and great fun. Loosen up - it's Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Free Slot Play is not worth the journey.”
Reviews.Author: bitesizecards
Reviews.Content: The Hooters Hotel and Casino is located off the strip, and although we didn't stay there during our visit, we were tempted to go in for the $200 Free Play promotion. The free play was limited to only a sectioned off area of 10 machines with a $5 play/game. The payouts for the machines were for chicken wings at Hooters, and other non-monetary prizes, with the exception of the top prize which was $1000. From what we witnessed during our play during the free slot play, no one won. ($200 only lasted about 7 minutes!)

Reviews.Title: “GOOD EYE CANDY AVERAGE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: RaiderRobert
Reviews.Content: pretty average place, no refridgerators in the rooms just an ice bucket which is a pain if you are staying more than one night. I stayed a couple so had to bring a cooler from my truck. The food was ok, drinks fairly cheap, I did get propositioned by a hooker in the sports bar area, so that wasn't too impressive. The girls overall look cute but tired, the pool area was nice overall it's ok if you want a cheap Vegas hotel for a couple of nights, but there is a "resort fee" to pay on top of your room price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, short walk to strip”
Reviews.Author: Trevor-EDM
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a fancy, over-the-top strip hotel then this isn't the place for you. The location is great, it's less than a 5 minute walk to the Tropicana or MGM. In fact, Hooters itself is set as far back from the strip as MGM's hotel is. The casino is small with only 20-30 tables and a bunch of slots. When we were there the limits were reasonable - there was some $3 blackjack and $2.50 roulette. Bud Light was always $1.50 at the bar. The waitresses in the casino seemed to bring drinks quickly. The rooms were what you would expect from a typical chain hotel elsewhere - clean and basic. Sure, there was the odd stain on the carpet, etc. but my thoughts are that's to be expected in a hotel of this star rating and age. Even Planet Hollywood has it's cosmetic issues. We had a non-smoking room and didn't notice any sort of smoking odors. Our room overlooked the pool, and from what we saw it looked quiet and fairly nice (for the price of the hotel). Again, it's not an over-the-top Vegas pool, but when you're paying $20/weekday night it's a very good pool. There was a nice water feature, a lot of chairs, and very few people there (and it was 30 degrees Celsius). It's set at the back of the hotel and near the elevators so you aren't walking through the entire casino just to get there. The service at check-in/check-out was average. No issues at all and nothing that was above-and-beyond expectations. Overall, my thoughts are that if you get a room with the expectations of a 3* property then you'll be fine. If you're expecting the equivalent of one of the 3.5* strip properties that is double the price then you're being unrealistic.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hoot”
Reviews.Author: mackozie
Reviews.Content: Great palce to stay considering the low cost. A huge Steak and two beers $12.38. And great steak too.

Reviews.Title: “always wanted too”
Reviews.Author: jamo89
Reviews.Content: been to vegas a few times but usually stay with friends but checked in for a few nights i think for the price you pay its across the street from the mgm and the strip i dont think you will get anything else that close that cheap and plus you can get wings delivered to your room

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sharif_M
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this: This hotel is just fine. I've seen many bad reviews, and have this to say: you can't pay for sirloin and be disappointed when you don't get filet. For starters the location is great. You are caddy-corner to MGM and the 2nd hotel off the strip. Being close to Excalibur gets you free train access down to Mandalay Bay as well. As for the rooms, our room was clean and smelled fine. Everything worked. It was definitely a 3 star hotel that could use a renovation at some point, but I paid $60 per night including the weekend (would have been $50, but I wanted the refundable rate just in case). The hall smelled odd every now and then, but never inside the room. I had to try several floors before finding a soda machine that took bills, but a minor inconvenience at worst. The pool area was small but peaceful. It had 2 hot tubs, but one was roped off. This is not a typical vegas hotel pool...think the size/atmosphere of a days inn or la quinta. But it was relaxing to sit out there. The bud light drafts were always $1.50, which was a great deal while sitting at the pool waiting for my wife to get her makeup on. We even tried the mad onion restaurant the last night for quick eats...the food was surprisingly good, and was cheap. Much better than an actual hooters restaurant. The casino was small and not as smoky as some of the others. The service and staff were all acceptable...I didn't need them much, and had no problems. Our bags were stored for free, and we had an early check-in at no charge. In summary, if you're looking for Vegas on a budget, this is a great place to stay for the price. I will probably go a little higher end next time I travel, but if I don't I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap , close to strip”
Reviews.Author: beachbreeze66
Reviews.Content: We found a great last minute rate here. I called the morning to check in and reservation got us a room to check into at 11am for only a $10 early check in charge. While not all casinos charge for early check in, $10 is cheap for Vegas. The room was clean and comfortable. The casino is kind of gross but not worse than other non fancy casinos on the strip. We were attending a concert at the MGM which made hooters a perfect location to stay. We were pleasantly surprised. Last thing is the pool looked small but busy, serving an older crowd. Not the place to go for a pool party.

Reviews.Title: “Gross room, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jaimee B
Reviews.Content: We got a deal through Travelocity so we didn't know where we were staying until AFTER we booked, we were not able to cancel. I called the day before we were to arrive to see if they had a crib available and the man told me they did and it was free. We left the playpen at home and when we got to our room, we called Guest Services to have a crib sent up. They called our room about 15 minutes later to make sure we were aware of the $25 charge. I told her we were told it was free and she said 'nothing is free'. We decided to get it anyways because our baby will only sleep by herself, it took 2 calls to Guest Services and over an hour to get the crib!! Terrible, terrible service. The room was disgusting, there was pee in the corner of the closet, the carpet was filthy, the tile in the bathroom had never been scrubbed, one of the beds was broken, I could go on and on and on. This hotel is disgusting and we will never stay there again. I wish I could give it 0 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine...”
Reviews.Author: miltonwar
Reviews.Content: This Hotel needs a restoration....we booked here because an expedia offer, so we didn't had a choice. Pros A walk distance from the Hotel to the strip. (5 minutes) near Mgm. Has a parking lot without any fee Has a Valet parking service Has a hooters restaurant Cons Rooms needs restoration Tv service has only 20 channels Doesn't have wifi This was not the Hotel I was looking for a stay in Vegas. You get what you pay. Cheap Hotel, Cheap everything.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - tetanus shot required”
Reviews.Author: amrm6224
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely filthy. Elevators beat up. Reminded me of some of the 50 year old hotels at the party beach. The doors were beat up by the carts going in and out the doors. Elevators were down. If you try to take stairs, you end up outside on the second floor. Can't get to the parking lot outside from the stairs. Elevators had graffiti in them. If you want to sleep - you can't. Air conditioning unit didn't buzz - it ROARED. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “This Hooters needs a support bra”
Reviews.Author: NCOutdoor
Reviews.Content: My company booked me last minute here for a conference at the Las Vegas Convention Center. Simply put: Don't Stay here. Most casinos in Vegas at least pump a masking scent into the place to cover the smell of people and smoke. At Hooters you get people smell and smoke, as soon as you walk in, the front desk is not even separate from the bar/casino areas. You'd think this place would be the flagship of the chain, nope, more like the garbage scow. The room I was booked into was on the wrong side of the 'resort' - the Bay View tower side. I don't smoke, I was not there to gamble or drink. My room was not a king but a smoking room twin. I got moved the next day to the Ocean view side and the room was nicer. A king with no smoking. However, I had no blanket for my bed, the A/C rattled the entire night, and I could hear my neighbor underneath the connecting door as he and his wife/girlfriend had fun. Just lovely. There is not even coffee in the room, you must buy a Hooters coffee mug and get refills in the convenience store there- refills being free. What?! I did not even have internet access for free, had to use an ethernet cable for $14, ethernet cables, who uses those anymore, every hear of wireless as in "under-wire"? The restaurant (formerly Montana's Steakhouse) was okay. The Hooters Restaurant, there again, should have been the best place in the chain to eat. My wings were greasy - stomach ache - the salad wilty and the service again, okay. This place is tired, it needs an update, cosmetic surgery and a lift, the decor is like a college room from This End Up and the service is simply...there. No smile from anyone the entire time I was there. You will pay for the 'resort fee' which I complained about, I did not use the 'resort'. At the very least you'd expect to see the best of the Hooters Girls there, again, second & third string. Oh, just so you know, while I was checking in I did call other places, the town was booked solid that week. Disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money. Stay here with confidence.”
Reviews.Author: beachbuddy10
Reviews.Content: 21 hours travelling didn't stop our aging legs going out on the town. A little slow to check us in, the staff more than made up by the time we checked out. No fewer than three ladies asked if we needed help finding our room (we did). We had coffee and pastries by the pool in the morning and the security guy chatted with us about life in Vegas. The place was clean, the room exceeded our expectations and the proximity to the Strip only added to our enjoyment. Even the taxi driver gave me half his tip back! Not that I was taking notes, but the legendary Hooters girls were stunning. For the record no happily married couple should ever have any worries that this hotel is in any way "unsuitable". It was all good clean fun!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Vegas! From bad to worse!”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: We understood that check in time was 4pm but decided to see if we could get the Whirlpool suite that we book earlier. We wanted time to relax and rest up for the evening to come. So they told us the room was not ready yet and they would put a rush on it to keep checking back with them. We did, still wasn't ready. Then they gave us a room number to check back on. Well come to find out that room number was not suppose to be rented out due to renovations. But they would give us someone elses room that has not checked in yet. I didn't think that was right either. When we got to the room, the counters were dusty and the whirlpool was dirty, so my husband tried to clean it out. Then the water would not drain. The button to turn on the whirlpool was grimmie and the whirlpool didn't work. So we called mangement and Said they would try to find us another room of the same type that had a whirlpool that worked. They rushed to get ready the room that was not available due to renovations. They had one hour to find us something and it took them two hours. The front desk was rude to us but the manger was really nice. The casino was clean and the dealers were nice.
