The thing I loved the most about it was that it didn't take itself too seriously. After staying in a hotel that tried waaay too hard, Hooters was a welcome relief. It was what it was and wasn't trying to be "lavish" and "upscale" like the rest of Vegas. In a town that can feel pretty pretenious, Hooters was a breath of fresh air and felt much more accessible to me than other places in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would look somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Vaca7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway back in August. Our stay was ok. The location was pretty good for the price especially considering most of the hotels were pretty expensive when we went. Played some slots at the casino, but didn't win anything. There was a horrible smell coming from our bathroom each morning which really bothered us! We also were only on the second floor when the higher rooms were requested. Lucky us, we got a view of a pair of panties laying on the roof right below us. Not the best view in town, but it was a funny story to tell. All in all it was an ok stay, nothing really 'wowed' us but nothing was terrible either. My husband and I are going back to Vegas in December for our anniversary and we are looking in to different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters has outstanding customer service & treat customers exceptionally.”
Reviews.Author: babylake
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping was outstanding!! Very personal in greeting you everytime they saw you, and did a wonderful job cleaning our room daily. Security was spectacular for me on one evening when I lost my cell phone and some honest person happen to turn it in, or one of the staff found it on the floor. The carpets looked good (looked maybe new). I'm sure they had to be. The entertainment (Purple Reign) was a blast!! And lastly, gambling is always fun at Hooters!! :)

Reviews.Title: “HOOTERS ROCKED!!!”
Reviews.Author: rockinfun
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas. We stayed at Hooters, which was within walking distance of LOTS of the fun places to see in Vegas! The room we stayed in had a GREAT VIEW of the city. Great size rooms. The beds were comfortable, and when we ran out of towels the maids were there, right away, with more. The food we ordered was really good, at all hours of the day! The staff was always around. I never had to walk around looking for help, they brought drinks while we played the games, and they were very very friendly! They took the time to tell us what to see forsure, and what to stay away from in the city. I would stay at Hooters again on my next visit. They have a SUPER POOL too, but I didn't have time to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Honest House Keeping Staff”
Reviews.Author: mlh5752
Reviews.Content: I dropped some money in the room somehwere and did not noticed until I got to my event. That evening when I returned to my room the money was laid out on my bed. I must say that the house keeping staff was very honest and showed great integrity.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: micheledietz
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I had a lovely stay at Hooters. The room was clean, comfortable and suited our purpose very well. It was a refreshing change of pace to come back to a more "laid back" hotel after the hectic pace, neon lights and large-casino atmosphere in Vegas. We attended a concert at the MGM Grand Garden Arena, so Hooters was conveniently located right across the street, which was fantastic as we did not have to wait the half-hour for a cab once the show let out! The only improvement I could suggest is that the beds have larger pillows! Nice pool and everything you need is right inside at Hooters!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: kbentley2418
Reviews.Content: A little off the strip...but the casino slots paid off so well we didn't really venture that far away! They also have great beer specials and cheap blackjack. If you're in Las Vegas on a budget...this is definately a great place to stay. Hot tubs were closed though most of our stay and the swimming pool was also closed a lot. We had a great time at Dixie's Damn Bar and all the casinos on the newer part of the strip are a 10 minute walk away. Had a great time. Would recommend. Rooms could be a little cleaner...and smelled a little musty....other than that....good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is great value......”
Reviews.Author: CairnsAussie52
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and enjoyed my stay in Las Vegas. The location is not too far from the strip at the southern end and not far from the international airport. Free chicken wings was a bonus. Beds were very comfortable and rooms quite large. I did not use the Pool but it looked welcoming. The free complimentary Elvis show was good also. Customer service was very good. Downside was the WiFi internet was not free which was disappointing. Had to go to McDonalds to use my laptop for some free WiFi internet something the hotel should provide free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Wings and atmosphere....betting sports at Hooters.”
Reviews.Author: jwatsky
Reviews.Content: A few friends of mine and I were looking to watch some football on Saturday so we headed into Hooters Casino Hotel. What a great experience the waitress Johanna was friendly, quick and kept our beers cold and coming. The wings, were excellent started with 30 and added 30 more all were hot and tasty. The sports book was quick and they had an electronic betting kiosk as well. The property was buzzing yet everone seemed in control and customers were having a good time. This was on Halloween day and they even have Hooters Costumes available for sell only on that day though.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK ELSEWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: britbrit15
Reviews.Content: There wasn nobody at registration when I checked in, I had to call for someone and when I did, he looked like he did not want to help us. The room wasn't sanitary at ALL. we found a womans press-on nail on the floor, the sink had dirt stains, the bathtub drained slowly, and we had to call for someone to fix the lights in our room because the switch was broken. The heater and air unit was also not working and I called the front desk for it to be noted along with the non working lights for this complaint! The best thing about this hotel is the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading promotions detract from mediocre stay”
Reviews.Author: Bandwannabe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel because they had a promotion for $100 in slot play. We paid the additional $100 over a comparable hotel thinking it would just be prepaying for our slot play (net effect). After arriving, we discover the hotel is clearly a conversion from an older hotel and they seem to have spent very little money trying to renovate this building. The bathrooms need maintenance (simple things like caulk to fix the leaks). While everything seems to be generally clean, my wife says it all smells like chicken. When trying to redeem the $100 credit from our package deal, we are told that it is just an advertisement and everyone gets $100 in "promotional" slot play. I'm already irritated that I paid an extra $100 to find out that all club members get $100, but also find out that the "promotional" slots are a specific set of slot machines that are $5 machines that require max play ($10). These credits are not able to convert to cash and the only winnings are in 10 different payouts ranging from tickets to the in-house show to wings to more promotional slot play. Nothing I saw indicated this was not $100 in play in the actual casino, so I'm quite disappointed with this experience. Overall, it's a mediocre casino and a lower mid-range hotel. It's fine if you really like Hooters, but even that experience was disappointing. We're certainly not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz - Not the Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: FasTxn
Reviews.Content: I guess since we didn't set our expectations very high, we weren't disappointed. Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the water was hot, and the location (for the money) couldn't be beat. We booked through vegas.com and got the room for $40 a night on the weekend!! The people were friendly and my wife wasn't uncomfortable because of the Hooter girls. I think they actually have more clothes on than most other casinos! Think of this hotel as something between Motel 6 and Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: cdkennedy59
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through a travel site that gave this place 3 1/2 stars, we had been to other places with that star rating that more than exceeded the quality however when we checked into hooters it was the opposite. The room was so run down that it looked like it was in a ghetto. The windows had previously had some form of sunshade film on them that had been torn off sloppy, the only veiw was of an airport runway, The beds were not comforatble, the elevators were always under repair of some type. The staff was not friendly at the front desk. The entire place was not a place for families, and I would not even give it 1 star. If you are looking for a nice place to stay when in Las Vegas this is not it. The machines downstairs also are rigged so that you spend a minimum 75 cents on a penny slot, and you won't win anything for the most part, your just throwing your money away here from check in to gambling floor. The food is not that great either and you get charged $1.25 for a small dip when you order the chicken wings and they don't tell you until you get the bill. Nothing here is worth anything. I will never again stay here and will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters hotel is just plain nasty!”
Reviews.Author: jmbrph
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in September, a Wed. & Thurs. The first room we were given was old and in desperate need of a remodel. The carpet was almost threadbare and soiled. There was a fake tree that looked like someone had gotten sick in it. The AC was noisy and old, windows dirty, need I go on? After complaining, we were moved to an upper floor that was supposedly updated. We saw very little difference it its condition. This place is nasty!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Stay at Hooters”
Reviews.Author: haragama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hooters Hotel as a family for four nights the beginning of August. I booked two rooms as they were 24 dollars each. I then found on the website that you get a room half price if you sign up for their email offers. I signed up and changed my reservation to get the twelve dollar room. Worth it! The sheets and bathroom were clean. The carpet had stains. We stayed in a bungalow room which had a patio door directly to pool area. Very convienent for the kids as well as sitting out by the pool. The water fall was not working. The hot tub didn't work either. All in all, a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - undelightfully tacky”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat71
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel the last time I stayed here, but this time was so disappointing. Check in was quick, we got up to our room to find it had been used after it was cleaned, rubbish in the bin in bathroom, towels used, bed unkempt, courtesy water used. We called down and were told someone would come up with keys to a new room and move our stuff for us, however the room we were moved to was 3 floors down and at a lower rate than we had paid for. We left our stuff in the room and went back to check-in where we were told by a bored member of staff that they'd move us after 8pm that night, but being tired from driving from LA we requested a reduction in cost and to stay where we were. We were offered $10 reduction!! We then found out the safe wasn't working so couldn't lock any belongings away and had to take everything with us for the day! The Hotel 2 rooms we saw looked a bit tatty and dated with stains on the floor, but the bathroom was clean enough. The pool is very small. Last year they had a DJ playing some cracking tunes, not this time (although we were there the same time of year). I know the Hotel is cheap and cheerful (or was the first time we stayed there) but it's in need of an update and a bit of customer service training, the check-in and Hotel guys don't live up to the friendly Hooters Brand and let the side down. I suggest staying in Tropicana or Excalibur which are the nearest and just slightly higher priced then coming over to Hooters for wings and a smile from their more friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, NEVER, NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Mrdenmark007
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Hooters. Trust me I will never come back. Front desk was very rude. I could give a name but that will probably be of no use – because the management do not care. The guy tried to cheat me and give me a room lower than what I have paid for and when I tried to explain it to him – he told me that there was other ways to get a nice room…………………………………… Why should I give a 10 or 20 dollar bill to get a room I already have paid for. Housekeeping was out of shampoo – at least I didn’t get any for 3 days!!!!! If housekeeping are not satisfied with the amount U give them – he/she will “forget” things  For the record I gave 2-5$ a day….. The two days I gave 2$ I could really see a diff. not for the better! The Aircon in the room are so laud that u can´t sleep. It can´t be turned off Hooters is 100% run down and they need to reconsider if it’s time to renovate the hole hotel and take staff on training. I know U get what u pay for – but…….I have been visiting many other hotels in Vegas and by far this is the worst. So…..I will never go back

Reviews.Title: “oh dear”
Reviews.Author: shelly5029
Reviews.Content: just got back from vegas and stayed here for a week its what you pay for , the hotel staff seemed bored with their jobs as in same old same old rooms are basic shower never worked took 3 days to fix it and still never worked ants in bathroom room carpert was dirty and the pool smelt of the sewer , only upside was food was good in the hooters cafe and the mad onion

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the bad reviews... give Hooters a chance, you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: JazzyCazy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few different hotels in Vegas in a variety of locations. Would I come back to Hooters? Absolutely! We paid approximately $20 per night which is a bargain. Yes there are $7.50 resort fees but that brought our stay up to $27.50 per night... still a bargain in my book. We requested a non smoking room away from the elevators and got 1147 which was an awesome room in the Ocean Tower with a great view of the strip. The room was clean. Yes it was old looking and there were some odd stains on the carpet, but who comes to Vegas to stay in their room?? Not me! We didn't use the pool facilities (Wet Republic at MGM is right across the street, if you want a fab pool go there). But the Mad Onion and Hooters restaurant were great, good food and good value for money. I'd say if you just want a place to crash in and don't want to pay a lot for it, Hooters is perfect. Our experience was great. The staff were friendly when we asked for anything it was given and the location is awesome, everything is a short taxi or walk away.

Reviews.Title: “One Hour in Vegas and a naked man”
Reviews.Author: onesmartcookie1
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the check in desk from our flight from Canada. I had signed up for their email offers because friends had recommended this hotel. So I recieved a one time deal of 50% off which worked for the weekend since weekend rates are always higher. The person at the desk wasn't at all pleasant and in fact I would say she hates her job. I asked her why she was swiping my card when the room was already paid for. She replied that it was for security reasons. As she turned her back to me I could hear her talking to the other person saying that I thought she was going to charge me again and laughed. She then took our key and slid it across the counter with no welcome or directions to the room. We wandered through the casino to ask for directions from a friendly slot attendant. When we got to the room, I swiped the card and opened the door. In the reflection of the mirror I saw a naked man laying on the bed in our room for all his bits to see! I turned to my partner to tell him and just as I did, a women from the room wrapped in the towel came to ask if we needed help. I was embarrassed and apologized. We headed back to the desk. On the way the slot attendant who helped us originally came to see if things were ok. We were directed to security. Security told me they would phone the room and I suggested that the people were interupted already so we contacted the Manager. We were told then to head back to the desk to meet him. Derek apologized and told us he would waive our resort fees and get us into another room. A larger more comfortable room. So, we then went to the room. Lots of orange, wood, King size bed and looked decent enough. Everything that we needed. The next morning, the rugs looked tired and there was hair in the walk in shower. Kind of gross. We stayed there three nights and towels were not changed by the maid. But, the rugs had been vaccuumed. The two bottles of complimentary water (resort fees) were used up and never replaced. The room adjacent to us with a locked door had two different guests stay. All of which we could hear the conversations. Our view consisted of the parking lot. I think it would be a great place for a boys get away or somewhere you needed just to sleep providing you don't have noisy neighbors. We enjoyed our Prime Rib meal at Mad Onion for $9.99, the beer for $1.49 and the Purple Reign Show was fabulous. The swimming pool looked like it needed a good cleaning after the night before. The $100 free slot play consisted of a promotional play area and the attendant putting your $100 into the $5 a pull slot machine. If you want to get to the strip I would suggest walking across the street and through the back of MGM otherwise you walk through a street filled with garbage and broken bottles not to mention a bit sketchy looking. After that experience we were thrilled to be heading to Monte Carlo for our last two nights!

Reviews.Title: “For vegas the rooms were very basic”
Reviews.Author: daysinnbeebe
Reviews.Content: Attended a conferance in Vegas and booked vacation package thru Continental Airways Vacations. I object to the room surcharge $8.00 plus tax just to use the pool. Will not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “outstanding value and great service all round”
Reviews.Author: gjm2783
Reviews.Content: I arrived at around 8pm. No check in line at all. Was slightly concerned as didnt have a credit card but they made it so easy and stress free and allowed me to put down a $200 deposit and they offered to take my resort fees out when i left and returned the rest. Perfect. gave me a Bay view room on the 8th floor overlooking the pool area. room was big, had a safe, cable tv and a good shower, excellent maid service also. room service food was nice, especially the all american breakfast. the casino is basic but the beer is only $1.50 for a bud which is great. the pool area is not over crowded you can always get a lounger and the bar at the pool has the same prices as indoors. location is good to as you can cross the road and go through the MGM to be right on the strip. Can't fault it at all excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and poor service. NO ONE was helpful or friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Boof72
Reviews.Content: Recently went on a trip to Vegas with spouse and some close friends. I was shocked at how rude and basically unprofessional the entire hotel staff was. Asked for directions to the wedding chapel and was told by bell staff, "Find a map" NICE! The hotel itself was in poor shape and VERY dirty. Pool area was disgusting and frequently you could smell sewer, or was that the smell from the green pool? Not sure on that one. Would spend my money somewhere more friendly and clean next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not real bad, just not much good, and way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DeweyA
Reviews.Content: First, the garage elevator wouldn't come to the top floor, and the garage elevators were hit and miss the whole time, and always hot and smelly. Then when I finally got to the desk, I made reservations in advance, and they did not have them, or had not put them into their system yet is what I got out of it. I was undecided which was worse, when the air conditioner was off and it was super HOT in the room and halls, or when the A/C came on and sounded like a vibrating steam roller that could fall out at any time. Best part was the free drinks while you gamble and a good rewards program, the club is not too bad. I'm not going to say I won't ever go back, because it wasn't that bad, but I don't know why I would, there are several much better options, for the same price or even cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: BajenNico
Reviews.Content: Me and 24 of my friends stayed at Hooters from september 6 - september 16 and we had a great time! Ok, if you are looking for top service, top restaurants etc you might want to upgrade to a larger hotel but for the price we payed (25 $) for 2 persons per night we could´nt stay better (ok, there is an extra charge of 8 $ per night for pool use etc, but thats less than most other hotels in Las Vegas...) Lovely pool area with 2 larger pools and 3 wirlpools, nice poolbar open until 8 pm every night (you can go swim 24h a day). There are 2 "real" restaurants in the hotel, Hooters restaurant is... a Hooters restaurant... nothing special but great for a quick bite and then the Onion, nice restaurant open 24h. (you should try the "Chicken and ribs" special for 9,95 $...) And when we stayed at Hooters there was a Bud special, also 24h, in all 3 casino bars (1,50 $/beer), that was also very nice...! And another thing that is a big plus is that it´s really close to the strip, it takes about 2-3 minutes to walk to the strip with NYNY hotel, Excalibur, Tropicana, and MGM Grand is just across the street! I can´t find anything to complain about, all of us had a great time at Hootels Casino Hotel! We will definitely stay there next year again!

Reviews.Title: “Room No Air And Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Waggie54
Reviews.Content: Me and my son drove from New York and spent 4 days and was the worse rooms we stayed at. They couldn't fix the air conditioner and the hallways where hot and when I went to the front desk and asked about it a gentleman made fun of me because I was complaining about it. After driving over 2,500 miles I would expect better service then we got.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: BadGirlVic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel Aug into Sept with partner. Been to Vegas Previous Year and this time went for what seemed cheaper option at Hooters. On Arriving to Hotel we paid the $8.40 a night room fee ($84 as stayed 10 nights) got room key all happy.... then girl said - and you need to pay your $25 a night deposit... Pardon?? This was not advertised anywhere. We had a budget of $150 a day and now told had to hand over $250!!!! Was told if put it on Debit card it would be refunded backk THE DAY WE LEFT. As this money was the only money we had when we got back to UK we went with that after checking with the girl 3 TIMES tht it would be refunded. Went up to room. VERY LOUD AC but try to leave it on in day with your curtains shut and you shouldnt need to have it on through the night. Cleanliness was average the hotel very worn. Gaffer tape over floor in casino... holes in chairs and stains on betting tables. Toilets did not flush well and sometimes had to go back for 2nd try. Staff... RUDE!!! Ugly people get put on reception and bar - and have attitude because they know thats the reason!!! Slightly less ugly people work in HOOTERS Restaurant (Wings MING!!!! couldnt finish them) One 'HOOTERS girl was a old as my gran and another was walking around 8 months pregnant!!! Drinks girlsthat come around when your bet make you feel as if its an effort to serve you and find a $1 tip offensive!! Bars are under staffed and staff are more interested in drinking table customers drinks and chatting to each other! Didnt find it very proffesional when a lady, who was quite drunk ,was losing at Blackjack while sitting at the Sports Book and staff continuly took the micky out of her with each other. Pool: Pointless... had a sewage smell.. Drinks double in price and Water dirty and very cold compared to other hotels. Situated in wrong place so 2 hrs sun a day. This then made me annoyed as i paid $84 resort fee - Pool, Gym, Water in Room (2 small bottles that were never replaced) and Internet (im on holiday dont need internet) so felt robbed by resort fees.NB: Ceasars Palace is open to the Public and amazing!!! Head there!! At Check out I asked if the 'deposit' was put back on my card - was told 'it will be ma'am in 5-7 working days'... Pardon? Yes 5-7 WORKING DAYS!!! so had to borrow money when returned from holiday until it was refunded. NOT HAPPY considering what we were told on Check in. So, Unless your staying in Vegas for 1 night i wouldnt recommend HOOTERS. If i had known now i would have had to hand out an extra $250 i could have stayed at Monte Carlo which was on the Strip and a really nice hotel with friendly staff. While out there they said Hotels often get knocked down for new hotels, latest being Aladdin for Planet Hollywood. Finger crossed Hooters will be next!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Party Animal”
Reviews.Author: alexcook22
Reviews.Content: We stopped at Hooters after spending 4 nights at Planet Hollywood, it was as cheap as places like Circus Circus but me and my wife had previously been there and are big fans of the place. check in was Speedy for a friday afternoon, we were in the ocean view tower on the 4th floor, being a weekend we did have some noisy girls in the ajoining room but what do you expect at hooters. bed was comfy, the ac was loud but to be honest, by leaving it on whilst out at night, we didnt really need it whilst sleeping. Rooms are usually $29 midweek which is fantastic value for what you get, if your on a budget and want to party then this is the place, Pool was great fun, Hooters Restaurant was as lively as ever, greaat time all round

Reviews.Title: “bloody mattress in room 415”
Reviews.Author: RevScott
Reviews.Content: I was Hooters walk-in. asked what was their best rate. the lady at the front desk tells me $39 plus the resort fee. i said ok and signed up for a room. I took my bag up to the room & immediately went out on the town. stopped by Fedex office to check my emails and happened to go to Hooters website to find out that their best rate for September 14 was $24, not 39 + the resort fee. I returned to the hotel at 2am. as i put in my card key to enter the room, i noticed a cockroach scurry between my legs. went to get into bed and noticed a dark spot on the sheet. thought it was good thing that my room had 2 beds. got up this morning (9/15/2010) and took a closer look at the dark spot on the sheets of the 2nd bed. it turned out to be a 2.5-3" diameter blood stain on the mattress that was showing through the sheets. i have emailed the President of Hooters Hotel Casino and i am awaiting a response. i have never felt a need to have a cell phone with a camera but i do now.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could tell you.... ' dont worry! '”
Reviews.Author: kissmecath
Reviews.Content: I will give u a true review - just might take a while... OK, coming from the Uk I am not used to a deposit on your stay, $25 A NIGHT ... me & my partner were there 11 NIGHTS!!!! - yes my liver is not talking to me! So on top of your night fee of ... $25 .... $50 also add $8.40 resort fee ... I just dont know where that goes this is a shed with a pond,,,, then add your $ 25 a night deposit...... you know where u are PH.... MGM.... anywhere but HOOTERS I will be honest... i arrived 28th Aug. 1ST day i thought ... ok, people pay for burger - expect steak.... day 2.... on my folded clean towels in the bathroom... someone else BLOOD..... yes, blood.... looked like from tooth, or something small..... but still not mine! We were on floor 16. ( i could go on !! ) We had a conecting room - the noise we crazy from the other room - but hell - we are in VEGES,,,, BUT .. i still dont need to hear EVERYTHING! So, I asked to move.... which they did... to floor 14 MUCH BETTER - bed good, bathroom clean. Though safe took 2 hr to change batteries? You want the truth..... the first 10 days ... nicest person.... the tramp that sits outside EVERDAY 10 -7 ... he is honest, funny and well worth a few dollers! Casino - the ' hooters girls' 1 .... was a theif! Some are nice ..Most.... unless u r 40 + male - and they think your are worth a few $... forget it. the theif.. put a straw into EVERY drink she serves, then, takes a bit...... OF EVERY DRINK!... tables are cheap 1 or 2 of the dealers are nice people. Although ID everyone under 40!? Bars - i lost the will to live - no lie - 15 min to get served, 1 person on th bar ..all the time...who could not care if you died of thirst! Unless you put down $5 tip you wait! About a week. Slots- more expensive than most other casinos - and at least other casinos you dont get half your drink stolen! Pool - smells, by 12pm 80% in the shade. Pool so cold i could not feel my feet. Mad onion - Really nice server - $9.99 rib dinner..... 90% fat........ $5 bud .. which is odd as $1.50 3ft away?? Hooters - again great srever - bad food! What we did..... Tropiciana next door - go in tell them you made a misake in booking - they let you use there pool. Eat any where else - we went to may buffets -most were good ( if you need details email me ) If i was headed 4 crash spot with mates I MIGHT if there was nowhere better, stay here again.................... but for the price , service, standard, and professionalism they need to not only improve - but have a whole change in out look. I would say - Dont go here unless you have low standards, and worst expectations.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vegassssss
Reviews.Content: You certainly get what you paid for. Just did not feel very welcomed. Had some issues w/ the room check--in. Had 2 men w/ 1 security knocking in my room claiming this room is supposed to be empty, because nobody checked in. What? How in the world did i get the key to this room then. It was just a mess from the first day. Not a very welcoming feeling from the very begining. The pool water was extremely cold. Everyone was in the hot tub when its 100 degrees???? Didn't see to many hooter girls. The ones I did see not pretty at all, although thats not to important. The rooms were clean had hot water both days i was there. Had a ugly view from my window. Overall i do not recommend this hotel, I will never stay here again. Spend a couple more money & stay at a nicer Hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “The quality of service has gone done since I have been staying here over the years”
Reviews.Author: robert0784
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the wings is all the have going for them. I have stayed at this hotel over 6 times. Each time I have stayed my service has gotten worse and worse. The drains in my room did not work well at all sink or tub.. The bath tub almost filled up before you could finish a shower. Their Owl rewards club is a joke. I lost $4,000.00 in one night playing blackjack and I got 100 points for it. The quote "free WIFI" didn't even work and I was on the 3rd floor. The room they put me in was so noisy from the industeral fams outside my window. Then to top it off I chaecked my account today and they have over charged me for things I cleared up at the front desk before I left. This place gets an F- because their customer service is so low.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting dont waste your time or Money.........”
Reviews.Author: jg1983
Reviews.Content: My recent Overall stay (9-11-2010-9-12-10) at the Hooters hotel in Las Vegas was well below expectation. At first glance the room looked clean, but upon further inspection the bathroom was filthy. The tub was disgusting with soap residue left from previous guest. The tub lacked proper disposal of water when trying to shower. It is very unpleasant to stand in dirty water while trying to get clean, especially if the tub lacked proper cleaning from housekeeping. The room had a smell from the kitchen, where fried food was being cooked. Mind you that we are on the 8th floor of the tower. Security was not very attentive to their job. For example, the front staging area where the valet is located, a red Jeep Cherokee was left running with the door open for well over an hour and nothing was done to have the vehicle removed from the property. Only action that was taken was an intercom announcement to be made. There wasn’t a door latch for the room door, which made my wife feel unsafe. The only lock there was, was on the door. The other door located in the room that adjoined the other room was thin and not sealed sufficiently. We were able to see through the door cracks when the lights were off, not to mention the noise. My wife did not sleep due to the neighbors coming in late and talking loudly. I will never stay or do business with any of the Hooters properties in the future. I was terribly disappointed with my stay at your Las Vegas hotel. I was so disgusted with my stay that I left after only one night and booked in another establishment. I came in with an open mind when booking at the establishment but I was clearly mistaken.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Laborer
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hooters 9/02-9/07. Lowest fares on or near the strip, but...because of the cheap fares, the other patrons were questionable. Noisey, drunk, in your face, gangster type, younger set...Overall the hotel is quite rundown. Needs alot of CLEANING. The clients at the pool area on the weekend were actually scarey to us white midwesterners. We never went in the pool or hot tubs. Looked quite scummy. We requested a poolside bungalow but upon checkin the desk clerk recommended a tower room. For whatever reason we were given a handicap room. It was clean & the new walk in tile shower was awesome. Always had hot water. But we had to tip the maid to get extra bath towels. No ice bucket. Hair dryer bracket fell off the wall. Kleenex never replenished. Slots were tight but so were all the other casinos. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the bad reviews???”
Reviews.Author: Scottster1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hooters right before Labor Day weekend and found none of the things that the bad reviews described. The hotel, pool area, casino, bars, and dining areas were very clean and spotless. The Bud beers are only $1.50 24/7 and the food was good and moderately priced. Although only a few of the Hooter girls were HOT (Vegas has a tremendous competition for hot girls elsewhere in the city) they were all very friendly and worked hard. BTW, I found their online site specials for $24/night while being a block from the strip and a mile from the airport. Las Vegas will nickle and dime you to death for everything now days, so the resort fee everyone complains about goes to the City of LV and the hotels have no control over this fee. I will NEVER bother with a rip off strip casino hotel again as long as Hooters is there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended & Unfortunately, the only above average were the beds/sleep for $42.00.”
Reviews.Author: Stop-to-Stop
Reviews.Content: Regardless of the price, with a BIG name like Hooters one's expectation for an above average to excellent stay is justifiable. In this scenario, while your signature BOOBS are wonderful, they were not enough...To put it plainly I did not feel welcome or invited. For the details, 1. The food was average and over priced for quality. 2. The rooms were not very clean but they were tidy. Our bathroom floor towel was dirty on the bottom. 3. The staff was nice, but I never felt like I or my family were important. (Sad) 4. The pool was not clean - I would not even take my son swimming and my wife said it looked like someone may have got sick earlier that day. 5. The overall energy was blah and fake, it did not make us want to stay and bet. 6. The hotel renovations seemed cheap and halfway done as to get the doors open. 7. The upsides are that the beds were comfortable, the waitress was pleasant and did work hard, and the extra towels did come quickly. Overall, for a Vegas hotel with a big name a blah/ low energy, low quality food, lack of cleanliness and an unwelcome feeling just makes me know to spend my money somewhere else! The only thing I want (I am not looking for any refunds or perks.) is for Hooters to redeem their name by stepping it up. If you want my suggestions, I will be happy to consult. Sincerely, Michael Creekmore (647823)

Reviews.Title: “If you've been to the Restaurant yo know what to expect.”
Reviews.Author: shootin4-7
Reviews.Content: This was a spontaneous, first time trip to Vegas. The Hooters Hotel and Casino was the best deal available considering how last minute my booking was. I read several reviews about this hotel and after staying there over Labor Day weekend, I have to say that the negative reviews for the most part are a bit unfounded. Yes, when you look at many of the other hotels in Vegas, particularly the MGM grand across the street, (the other couple we were with stayed at Caesar's Palace and they said the MGM was better), the Hooters pales in comparison. However, that's not to say it's a bad hotel. If you have ever been to Hooters, then you know what to expect. The hotel IS the restaurant with a place to sleep. Check-in was quick and the customer service was great. The two issues I encountered were easily remedied. First Issue: We were originally given one of the ground floor bungalow rooms. The patio door did not lock, which was a safety issue considering it opened right out to the parking lot. One phone call to the front desk and we were quickly moved to a larger room in the Bayside Tower. Room was basic but clean. Second Issue: Internet in the room did not work, but I was able to take my laptop to the Bait Shoppe, (24 hour onsite convenience store), and plug in right there for FREE, avoiding the $12 internet fee altogether. Yes, the carpets in the HALLWAYS ONLY were a bit worst-for-wear, but the carpet in the room was clean, no stains, but really carpet? There are lots of pluses to this hotel. Location: 10 minutes from the airport, walking distance from 24 hour liquor store, across the street from the monorail and the MGM Grand, walking distance from the strip. Pricing: Drinks are literally 50% cheaper than if you bought them at another hotel. Plus you can buy a bottle of your favorite spirit right at the Bait Shoppe, (little bit of a markup), but given that you can walk with your drink throughout Vegas it's a good way to drink on a budget. Table games had pretty low minimums, which made for more gambling with less risk. 24 Hour Amenities: The 24 hour pool is an awesome amenity; there was always someone out there. $3 meal after midnight at the Mad Onion was awesome after staggering back from the club at 5am and the Bait Shoppe access was great too. Gym was nice too! As a gym rat that is important. By Vegas standards Hooters is certainly a no frills hotel. If you are in Vegas to spend the bulk of your time on the casino floor and take advantage of the Hotel amenities then you should book elsewhere. However if you are looking for a decent place at a good price that you can use as your home-base while you explore the strip, Hooters is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: aminard_7
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed after how much money this hotel cost, that it was not a lot nicer. The impression you get when you first walk in is that it is not clean. The promotion says that you get $100 of free play when you stay there, but it is a gimmick and rigged machines that you only get 10 spins on. Of course, we won nothing. The room was okay but not anything special. Old TV and fixtures. First morning, I went to blow dry my hair after a shower and it was broken with pieces missing. It took them 30 min to bring me a different one, and then just handed the wall unit to me instead of replacing it. You could tell the toilet had been snaked in the past and first day, the toilet plugged. They came up and plunged it, but about 2 flushed later it was plugged again. The next day the toilet flooded over and we called housekeeping and a lady came and took a report, but again it took 30 minutes for them to come and unplug it. No comp was offered for all this trouble. ... We will NEVER stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED THE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly45
Reviews.Content: I read all kinds of bad review, like carpets old and stained, dont stay in anything under the 10 floor , no hot water, and pull and spa were out. But, i went ahead and decided to go there as the price was right. When we arrived we were greeted friendly, the deposit is only 25 dollars which we have been in others in Vegas for 100+. We checked in quickly and went to our room on the 3rd floor in the Ocean View tower. It was beautiful, clean and the carpets were new. We went to the pool everything was open and great, a beautiful water fall and pool towels were provided. Dinner was wonderful and we got 100 dollars in free slot play for joining there club. When i called about no ice bucket minutes later a very nice man came up with a filled one and 4 cups . The strip was just a couple minutes walk we were across the street from the MGM and next to the Tropicana. When we checked out the 25 dollars was put immediately on my credit card and i paid the 8.40 resort charge. I would recommend it!! Motel 6 is next door and is crappy been there done that and this cost less and was like being at a 5 star hotel. It made my birthday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl69x
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel with some 'interesting' guests. I did get an extremely cheap rate and wanted it for one night close to the airport, so it was value for money, but I wouldn't recommend it as a place to stay on holiday unless you are really struggling for funds!

Reviews.Title: “Way nicer places”
Reviews.Author: firefighter438
Reviews.Content: Knew it was going to be a bad stay when we pulled up and there was trash and debris all over the parking lot and 3 out of the 4 hand rails were roped off for painting. Next we were greeted with a very rude receptionist who could care less if we checked in or not. We got our room number and proceeded to the bungalow suite. As we walked to our room which was out by the pool we were hit with a foul smell (think of the worst port-o-potty you have ever been in) And also the smell of used grease from the restaurant. Still our hopes were high until we were hit with another cover up smell in the room and then the list of things wrong started to pile up. First the safe was locked so we had to call security to open it. While we waited for security to show up my wife went out the back patio door fo a smoke and the sliding glass door fell off the tracks, so then we had to wait for a maintenance guy to show up well 20 minutes later I finally fixed the door myself. Then it wouldn't lock so when security finally did show up we got it to lock with some team work of pushing and pulling. So we finally decide to shower and wouldn't you guess it the shower didn't work! Which was followed but a hair drier that didn't work. Finally after three hair driers later we were out the door. You would think after all the complaints and misfortunes we had that they would try to make us happy by an upgrade when all of this was brought to their attention but they just moved us rooms. It was just a real disappointment from the time we stayed there four years ago! The only positive thing was the spicy bloody marys and one of the dealers Eva was a real treat very friendly and personable!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY”
Reviews.Author: babysue46
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, for my husband and I to stay in after we renewed our vows. We were already staying in our time share in Vegas, but wanted a night alone way from all the family. We had our family dinner at the Mad Onion at the hotel, that was so nice, then we played in the casino which was nice too. Then all changed when we went to our room. Now we checked in at 4:00 p.m. and just layed our stuff in the room and went to Dinner, and gambles for awhile, when we finally went to our room it was 12.00 p.m. well that is when we finally got to see our room. We could not belive that a well know name place would look so nasty. The floors were stained the bed was a mess like it had never been clean. The Toilet did not work. I can go on and on. I went down to the desk, to get our money back, they refused to give our money back because we checked in at 4:00 and now it was 12:00, then they charged us an extral 8.00 for taxes at the hotel. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here the past 3 years when in Vegas and have had nothing but a pleasent experience each time”
Reviews.Author: risingsunhrs
Reviews.Content: When my travel agent first recommended Hooters i though I don't know but what the heck i'd give it a try and i'm glad that i did. I found the staff to be very pleasent and helpfull. I found it to be a very clean place and had no problems what so ever, I've stayed there the past 3 years i went to Vegas and will stay there again in April 2011 when i go again. Food was great at a reasonable price and i liked the casino alot. All in all i would recommend Hooters as a travel destination in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, casino was fun, room was...........OK”
Reviews.Author: Bostsean
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Bay View room. The room was big and attractive, but the carpet really needs to be replaced. It was clean enough, but old and worn. I liked the in-room safe and the half balcony overlooking the pool. The TV (and clock-radio) were old, bed was comfy and the furniture was nice enough. Maid service was good - even gave me a couple of extra bottled waters when I asked. The pool was very nice, although both whirlpools were both closed. I liked that the pool was 24 hours and had a fun bar out there - not too many kids running around either. The pool never seemed particulary crowded. The casino was a very fun place to be, and the dealers, bartenders, waitresses and other employees down there were cheery and efficient. Budwiesers were only $1.50, a real break from Vegas strip prices. I ate breakfast in the 24hr restaurant and it was affordable and pretty good - I thought the sausage links were great. Overall, you get what you would expect from the cheapest room in the area. The location makes it easy to walk to the ritzier joints on the south strip.

Reviews.Title: “Do not pass up this deal! I for one will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: reginashanta
Reviews.Content: The other reviews had gotten me so nervous, I came armed with my own sheets for the bed and flip flops to walk on the nasty carpets; neither was necessary at all! The deal was so cheap I thought there had to be a catch but was so completely happy with our stay I would for sure come back again! The $100 in free slot plot was misleading and the fact that there was no hot water when i went to shower were my only complaints. The room was clean, well furnished, and comfortable (we were in the bungalows) and all service was prompt and polite.I think i drove my husband crazy because I would not stop commenting on how happy I was with our accomadations after what many of the reviews had lead me to expect. The food at the restaurant was fine and the location to the strip was great, plus the beers are super cheap! Overall I am a VERY pleased costumer.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal near the airport”
Reviews.Author: kvanderson49
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 other times so I might as well write a review. First of all, this hotel is a pretty good bargain if you want to be near the strip or need to catch a plane. The rooms are good sized and the decor is nice. The pool area is also worth mentioning as it is attractive, has an outdoor bar, and has good outdoor seating. The hooters restraunt has decent food but the beer was not the icy cold that one expects from this chain. The casino was small and had rather high minimum bets. The service was prompt and courteous although somewhat indifferent. All in all, it was a good deal notwithstanding the resort fee which seemed to be missing the resort. It is not the place to go if you want a 5 star experience but for the money a very pleasant place to stay for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell Is Too Good”
Reviews.Author: Justine2u
Reviews.Content: Here is the problem. They do nolt tell you about the $8 per night "Resort fee" which makes this hotel higher than than many on the Strip. It is the nastiest hotel I have seen. The carpet is beyond filthy, the bathroom floor was filthy. The hotel is absolutely sorry. I booked here because of the free food and $100 to gamble with. Neither of which proved to be what they were advertised to be.. Tne only good thing is it is located on the side of the MGM so you can walk through the MGM and cross the street. Many people are deceived because they believe the quality they see at a Hooters restaurant will be here. Such is not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: amjIowaGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Las Vegas. We travel there a couple of times a year on average. We have stayed at the many of the nicer hotels on the strip and they are great, however, I do not expect to get the same services I have enjoyed at those hotels for $20 per night. This visit we were with our teenagers. The hotel worked well as it was small enough we did not lose each other, had a good pool, good food options. I saw many other families with teens/college age kids. We had great meals at Hooters and Mad Onion. The gift shops are lots of fun and the kids had fun shopping for their friends there. The staff at restaurants and at the front desk were very helpful. I noticed a mistake on our bill after checkout and called back, spoke to Donavan - very helpful and friendly. The beds were very comfortable. I cannot complain for the rate we got. However, if the hotel wants to improve and attract new customers I would suggest the they paint and carpet the rooms ( the decor is very nice just needs a little freshening), improve the lighting quality in the halls (not for safety, just appearance) improve the elevators, and finally update the bathrooms a little. the rates could easily be higher and I am certain people would be more than willing to pay higher rates,

Reviews.Title: “hooters hotel casino”
Reviews.Author: KeithyS
Reviews.Content: decent hotel nice rates, great pools. Big room. good location to the strip on the south end of strip, public transportation (bus) nearby. Close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters”
Reviews.Author: DavidM230
Reviews.Content: If I were you, I would just put the do not disturb sign on the door, and keep the housekeepers out of your room. They don't do the best job, and I couldn't find my computer case. I think they threw it away by accident. But, you can't beat the price, and the music in the game rooms rock. I would check out the Prince show if you have time. The comedy of Todd Paul wasn't that great. He took almost 25 minutes to do one card trick.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Great Location with extra promotion incentives”
Reviews.Author: c0h
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location. It was an easy walk to many Casinos, next to Tropicana , then Excalibur which Trams to Luxor and Mandalay. Near Ny NY and MGM Grand.The room had a lot of little problems. Main Door would not Lock had to call Maintenance took 15 minutes, bathroom door knob also stuck. Beds were comfortable, TV was good, Pools were cold but open 24 hours, and hot tubs were good. Best thing, location to Big Casinos. Worst thing, Lack of fun things to do in casino and at the pool, they advertise parties but I couldn't find any. P.S. $7.50 per day resort fee and $12.95 per day internet fee.

Reviews.Title: “More than a mouthful???”
Reviews.Author: PRL3
Reviews.Content: 1st time to Vegas for my wife and I - spent 4 "nights" here. We stayed here mainly due to the deal we got on a package through Sam's Club and the proximity to the strip. We read pages upon pages of reviews - and still decided to try it out! One of the first things I learned about Vegas - your room is just for quick naps and you're hardly ever in it. With that said, at $15 per night....do you need 5 stars? We had a king-bed room on the 9th floor with a view overlooking the strip - Tropicana, Luxor, MGM, NY/NY, Excalibur. I thought it was pretty awesome! The room cleanliness was 3.5/5 - "wing sauce" stain on the floor and missing complimentary toiletries (namely shampoo and conditioner). Bed had a down comforter and was pretty comfortable. A/C unit worked well and the blinds made the room extra dark (especially when we went to bed at 9am)! We swam one night at about midnight - the pool area was pretty much ours. Two OK hot tubs and two decent pools. The one with the waterfall was to cold for me and I'm used to swimming in 70 degree Lake Erie! You don't have to bring a towel, they are provided in the "resort fee" at 24/hr gift shop. The towels are very small - you might want to grab two! If you're going here to see "world class" Hooters girls...don't. I counted three pregnant one's in the 30 minutes it took us to eat dinner! The Hooters restaurant on site is average - there are much better food choices in Vegas than this! My wife and I really enjoyed the casino as inexperienced gamblers. The drink always seemed to flow very freely on slots and at tables. We played roulette for the first time here - the table attendant was not friendly, but the couple sitting next to us helped us out a lot. We purchased a package that included 2 tickets for 10 free wings (they wouldn't let us use it at the same meal- so we gave one away!!!), 2 free drinks at the pool bar (waited 15 minutes for service), 2 free tickets to a show (we chose the Dirty Jokes show - worth it for "free!"), $100 in slot play (laughable!)...and I think 2 more free drinks. Although near the strip...sometimes it felt like it wasn't easily accessible. IT IS NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO CROSS VEGAS STREETS AT ANYWHERE BUT A CROSS WALK/BRIDGE. We bought a 3 day monorail pass instead of using taxis. The monorail station was at the MGM and directly across the street from Hooters. However, you had to walk a block or two up to get to a crosswalk and then the same to get back down to the station. I guess I am just used to "J" walking whenever I need to cross a street! OVERALL - I would "probably" go back...my wife wants to stay on the strip. However, we both had FUN! We gambled there a lot and have not gotten any comps/offers in the mail. I spent a lot less at other casinos and have all ready received comparable rates to the package we bought. If you're in your 20's or early 30's or are just a cheapskate, then this hotel maybe for you. It reminded me a lot of my fraternity house in my college days - spilled drinks and sticky floors in the elevator, puke in the hallways, scantly clad women walking around, random stains in the carpet, mis-matched paint on the walls, etc...but an over all good time! Last comment - stated a 100 times in other reviews - the internet is not free and I think it was a wired connection!!! We fortunately had our Blackberry's - but in this day and age to not have a FREE wifi hotspot....come on!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to HOOT about!”
Reviews.Author: marinedon
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I stayed here because it was so cheap. My first surprise was the resort fee, which other resorts have but at least you get something for it. I need to check wifi and was told there was an extra charge. The room was dirty- every night I would return to the room and the ice machine right down the hallway would be leaking so they had a fan blowing down to try and dry the floor (didn't work). Made the hallway musty and smelly which made it into the room. I tried for a room switch but they had nothing available. I was there in December just before the holidays and the pool was closed, they didn't let me decided if I thought it was too cold, other places would have . The food in the restaurant was awful not Hooters quality! The Mad onion was under staffed and I was never able to get in late nite. The casino is small and unless you want to wait around you won't get a seat at a table. They advertise $3 blackjack, but only have 3 seats. I didn't find the staff to be rude, they just seemed to have an attitude of not caring. I even tried to write to the hotel about my experience and never received a response. I would not stay here again, you can if you like (its cheap enough) but don't expect much, that way you will not be disappointed. Hooters should be ashamed to have their name associated with this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Stay on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: markinoc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and I always have fun. Yes, the place is not the Wynn, but if you are expecting five stars and nitpick over every little thing, then of course you will be disappointed. (Posting pictures of door hinges? Really?) The place has a fun, casual vibe. The staff are friendly. Drinks are cheap and table minimums are low. If you like to take pictures of door hinges and post them on your review, then this probably isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “You get what u paid for”
Reviews.Author: tish196
Reviews.Content: Stayed at vegas b4 but never here.....thought i try it cos it had a slot promotion w/ free drinks and free wings.....thought the more money we save on a luxury hotel the more we had to gamble with....First the promotion was awful!!!.....sure they give u $100 free play, BUT u have to play one of the 12 machines(that they rigged where u cant win)....its $5 machine, which its gone in a matter of 2 minutes and the slot host that u give ur voucher to says u only can keep it the money u win IF its the jackpot....then thing is the desk gives u a voucher to give slot host they WONT give u the $100 where u can play whatever machine u want, BUT she puts in $100 dollar bill, go figure??????????.........WORST promotion I ever heard of!!......................The free drinks are only form 4p-7pm, and its 1 drink, but the promotion online says free DRINKS, w/ a "s"..................who wants to hang around for 1 free drink at a certain time??????...They never mentioned the certain time on the website..................like the free chicken wings ONLY EAT IN, u cant take out......all promtions at this hotel was worthless, I could have stayed at MGM but I didnt..my lose. Called desk told them about water pressure and tub was stopping up, called twice when i was waiting for them...............waiting and waiting was taking time from my day, no one came.....It defintley needs updated, the carpet had stains all over it was nasty!!!.....The only good thing was the matress was nice n firm...pillows were awful, softer than a babies bottom!....................No, I wont come back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best locale ever!”
Reviews.Author: joeyd69u
Reviews.Content: The gaming was great plus they gave us $100 free game play with our room and the food was excellent! The pool was very clean and the restraurant / pool area was upbeat and fun. The show we saw (Purple Reign) at the hotel was the most entertainment we had on our trip.Our room was clean and very quite. Location was the best! Walking distance from everything. We really loved our trip to Vegas and our stay at Hooters was the highlight. Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: dadofkmm77
Reviews.Content: Okay, here's the skinny.....for what I paid I had bad expectations going in......I was pleasantly surprised!!! My stay was sandwiched aroud a three night stay at a very high priced hotel....two days at Hooters at each end. Sure I missed the four star, but my stay at Hooters was was pleasant enough. Now for the bad, the fist two night I had a room by the elevator......big mistake, it was very noisy....I made sure that didn't happen when I went back......The room was clean and the staff was accomidating........some of the things others complained about.....dirty trays in the hallways and such, were none existant.....some people just need to complain to justify their pitifull existance, they need to validate themselves.....these are people I pity...to go thru life like that,,,,Karma is a pain!!!!! If you need a cheap place to lay your head, make the reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra 5 bucks, stay somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCabron
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that it started with a not before mentioned "resort fee" of about 9 bucks. Front desk people were not any help. Said there was nothing they could do. Action in the casino sucks. The room were pretty messed up. I rented two rooms for the weekend and both had clogged toilets, one tub was clogged. Hooters restaurant was typical except for the wait, the service ,the girls... It Sucked! The only thing I liked was the comedy show, it was good. SPEND YOUR MONEY AT MOTEL 6 BEFORE YOU STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on the strip! Customer service was very poor.”
Reviews.Author: Sunny4hunnybunny
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend staying at the Hooters Hotel. The rooms are disgusting! We checked in and our sheets had blood all over them and stains on the comforter. This issue was brought to the attention of the Front Desk and a phone call was made to Housekeeping. They were very rude and did not make an attempt to change the soiled linens or service the room until 24 + hours later!!! This hotel does not have enough staff to accomodate the guests. The rooms wreak of smoke and other odors, the bathroom and hotel room itself were in bad shape and very dirty. I will never stay at this hotel again and do not recommend it to anyone... Even as a last resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Taradise1970
Reviews.Content: We thought Hooters was a great value for our money! Everyone else from my group was staying at the MGM, so we wanted to be close to them. Hooters is right across the street! Very good location to NY NY, MGM & the monorail. I loved the small casino! Much easier to get free drinks, when playing table games, then the bigger casinos, such as MGM. And the lower minimums on table games, was great too. I would stay there again, in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: MA_Browne
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5* hotel! Some people reviewing this hotel here have serious delusions in their reviews. For what it is - a budget hotel - it is fantastic. Good location opposite the MGM Grand, not far from the airport, some very pretty girls in the restaurant, very very courteous staff and great service. The rooms were enormous, the largest of any budget hotel I've ever been in. Let's face it - if you're in Las Vegas, it's not like you're going to be spending much time in your room. Therefore, why spend silly money on the strip? If you want to do Vegas on a budget, Hooters is a great choice. One small thing - there's a misconception that Hooters is a hotel for guys only, with girls in tiny shorts floating about everywhere. This isn't true - I saw lots of couples and families at the hotel. In fact, I got talking to my neighbour on the 5th floor who was a lady from Minnesota who was sharing a room with her elderly mother who was seriously ill and wanted to do Vegas while she had the chance. The next morning I spotted them, hungover and having gone to see an all-male strip show the night before. Now that is living the Las Vegas dream

Reviews.Title: “Good God people...it's Hooters”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Baby_10
Reviews.Content: If you want a high class hotel and service people kissing you as$ go somewhere else. This is a very laid back place. We have stayed here 5 years in a row and have a great time. The rooms are nothing compared to the better hotels, but if you're in your room that much you're missing the point of going to vegas. Get downstairs and watch the sexy Hooters girls dealing cards and serving drinks. If that offends you...Good God ...it's Hooters people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Vibe, Great Service, Great fun”
Reviews.Author: RyanUKLondon
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed there for a week at the start of June. We had previously been to the casino just for the gaming (small area, but the croupiers are very friendly and create a fun atmosphere while playing - High fives from the girls when you win, and general banter while you play), so we knew what to expect in respect to décor (delightfully tacky etc.). What we didn't like: *Yes it could be a little cleaner... but it wasn't that bad, especially for the price. *The famous Hooters wings are awful, maybe that's just our Australian pallet *The towels for the pool area are small (Just take two) What we did like: * The Mad Onion : consistently good food 24 hours for a reasonable price (service very good) * The service - Special mention goes to Toya on the front desk for changing our room as the Air/con broke, and for putting up with my dad calling her Toyota - seriously she did everything with a smile, and made sure that we were taken care of. STEVE at the mad onion bar - i travel a lot and he has to be one of, if not, the best bar tenders i have come across. He remembered all or names (group of 4), engaged in good conversation with us and all others at the bar, remembered how we like our drinks, and mixed them to perfection, took care of table bookings, kept us up to date with the basketball scores. * The gym, all new equipment, very clean * While playing the drinks are served hard and fast by the hooters girls, never was I left without a drink * We were there a week and all the staff on the floor recognised me and my brother and were always very friendly * The pool, is nothing like the Mandalay bay, but its just what you need on those very hot days - the waterfall was as good as a massage * The people staying at the casino are there to have fun, so the hotel has a very friendly vibe All in all there are "nicer" hotels, but for what you get for your money why go anywhere else. If you want perfection go elsewhere, if you want to enjoy your Vegas experience and not bothered by the small details stay at hooters

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service & dirty hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stephnut20
Reviews.Content: I have never felt so unwelcome or disappointed staying at a hotel. The first experiance was with the food & service inside the hooter's restaraunt, they took 30 minutes to get us a pitcher of beer and when we got it the waitress spilled it on the table and all over one of our hats. When we got our food my salad had rotten veggies on it making it pretty much impossible for me to eat. While we were there every employee but one rude. They advertised $100 free promotional play which was a crock sinc eyou had 12 machines roped off and that is where u had to play your $100 the machines didn't even pay out unless you got the jackpot amoutn, all you earned was points!! The sinks all backed up in the womens restroom one night which inturn they had to close the whole restroom. Only one elevator worked for 3 of the 4 days we stayed and our ice machine only worked for 1 day. When we tried to use our free show ticket voucher we couldnt becuase the shows were always sold out WHAT A RIP! Cocktail waitress's were hard to come by as well making us go to other hotels inorder to gamble and actually get service. I guess you get what you pay for but you would think employees would actually be cordial.

Reviews.Title: “I've been in nicer combat zones”
Reviews.Author: neilx
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have ever made, but thought I had to. As I said, I've been in nicer, cleaner, and quieter combat zones. I looked for a cheaper room than I normally do, because I was going to be by myself and figured if I was on the strip, how bad could it be? Well, after reading a few bad reviews, I inquired at the hotel, and upgraded myself ($$) to a room that they said would be nice. Oh My God!!. I stayed on the 18th floor, and it and the carpet in my room had never been cleaned. I had to where my shoes inside the room because I didn't want my feet, or sock touching the nasty floor. Room service trays filled the halls, and were never picked up in 4 days. Thugs and gangstas filled every room around me yelling, fighting, and smoking everything you can imagine. Refrigerators were said to be available, along with internet service-upon request. That was $40/ day, so I just got the internet for $15/day- it didn't work till my last day. Most of the elevators need to be comdemned because they rarely work. The girls in the casino are- well- look like crack/meth addicts, and will slip something in your drink- I guess so you'll get messed up and give them a bigger tip? the only descent looking girls where servers at the breakfast buffet. I wondered why there were so many guys messed up out of they're minds while on the casino floor, and security did nothing. The pool was said to be heated to 90 degrees, but no one could get in it because it was so cold. If you're thinking about this hotel because of the price and location- don't do it. I help design, and open, the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino- which just finished an amazing expansion- I was going to stay there, and now wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good location, nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mikni
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here in 5 years and the only Vegas hotel I've stayed at twice. No, it is not top of the line by any means but the room was clean and comfortable. I love the location down on the South end of the strip. The price for the room was great. I'd rather save on the room and have more to eat and gamble with. Plus when back at the hotel for the evening, the machines were good and the casino was not too large where you would loose you friends. If I don't stay downtown, I will stay at Hooters.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Twenty/Thirty-somethings on a budget looking for a good time!”
Reviews.Author: berg1438
Reviews.Content: We chose this location due to its proximity to the strip and the price. Located by MGM and the Tropicana, it was an easy walk to places such as the Luxor, Excalibur, and NY NY. Once we got there, we appreciated the small size of the hotel/casino. It was easy to navigate and get in/out of your room. The pool area was also intimate. Our favorite part about the place was the pool. Since most of the guests were in their 20s/30s, the atmosphere was much more casual and rowdy (but not obnoxious) than some of the higher end hotels. The bar by the pool was great too. The rooms were older and slightly run down. Baseboards were detaching from the wall and some of the tile in the bathroom was a little chipped, but the place was clean and the beds were comfortable. We had little to no problem with noise. If you don't mind an older rundown hotel and want a nice pool for a great price and decent location, I highly recommend Hooters. However, if you are looking for glitz and luxury, you're better off staying somewhere else. After all, as the Hooter's motto goes, it was "delightfully tacky yet unrefined."

Reviews.Title: “Hooters in Las Vegas - terrible place, stay away.”
Reviews.Author: janese051
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the worst place I have ever stayed. Hooters bought an old hotel and stuck up some wood to make it look like Hooters and that is it, This was not a cheap priced place but the rooms were cheap looking and there was not even a good lock on the door. One very loose rickety lock - no security lock, not even a chain lock. My firend and I put a chair under the door knob. The halls were dark and smelled .My key card did not work and it was a hassle to get a new one.. Everything about the place was cheap except the price. A Motel-6 would have been better. Thank goodness we were only there for 2 days and then moved. We thought it would be a nice smaller place to stay close to the MGM for the ACM awards. Wrong. We would have been better off at the MGM and it probably wouldn't have cost anymore. Terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Tomash226
Reviews.Content: nice welcome, they searched for a good rate for us and we got a nice room for 60 bucks. nice pool outside, casino was pretty good as well. overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “What can you expect for $50 including all taxes”
Reviews.Author: steve375
Reviews.Content: Old and not much money spent on keeping the rooms updated. Stains on the carpets. You really can't expect much for a room the sells for under $30. A little less than $50 with all the taxes in Vegas. The restaurant is up to the usual Hooters standard for food... I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GBA7154
Reviews.Content: From the time I checkin to the time I (had to leave) . The staff was very freindly and the food is great. My room was very clean and the housekeeping crew was accommodating.The pool is Fantastic,and well keeped. I had NO problems at all .Even with the Economy and travel the way it is today, This place is very nice and is a great location to enjoy Las Vegas from. AND IT HOOTERS ......what more do you need!!!! If you go to your neighberhood Hooters and enjoy the food as well as the people, you will ENJOY this place. IT IS OVER THE TOP...........

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: Nihilist999
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, eh? Considering we went during the week with the summer promotion we didn't pay much! About $25 per night, anybody who complains about a hotel on the strip at this price needs to be shot. The $100 free slot play was a joke, they even gave me an extra $100 and I lost $200 in about 5 minutes. The free comedy show was great, Geechy Guy is the man! The pool sucked. The casino was super small. Never ate at the restaurants. Location was good, just a hop, skip, and a jump to the strip or the MGM and the monorail. The rooms are ok, pretty good size. The front desk chick upgraded us to a strip view room since it was my bday. All in all was happy with the joint.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Hooter's is a friendly, small casino.”
Reviews.Author: Vern058
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hooter's 4 or 5 times a year . . . the food is better than adequate, its location is perfect; but the best feature of Hooter's is the staff. The girls are beautiful, and ALL of the dealers are friendly partly because they get to keep their own tips. They have some casino games that are not found in most of the other Vegas casinos and the pit bosses, dealers, and hostess (Faye) are outstanding. The building and rooms are not as fancy as the mega resorts, but it is a small friendly casino. I will continue to visit Hooter's.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BoatMom
Reviews.Content: Hooters Hotel and Casino left me with positives and negatives. Pros: really friendly staff, the bartenders were very nice and the food was very good. We also liked the smaller, friendlier casino environment. The pool was adequate for our purposes. Cons: They gave us a room with two double beds (which really were twin size beds) and I would have preferred a king bed as promised. The bathroom was a bit outdated. The hallway carpets are dirty but our room carpet was clean. We did enjoy the summer special which included free wings and a comedy show, which was really quite hilarious! Overall, a good value for what you pay...the location is convenient and you can catch the monorail across the street at the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “One mild half step up from Circus Circu...”
Reviews.Author: eraumon
Reviews.Content: One mild half step up from Circus Circu. Alot more graduated low bar frat partyers from ASU and UofA hanging out here. Everything is done scary cheap and many don't mind because they are too trashed. The pool is terrable with about two hours of sun light hitting it a day, most of the hall ways smell like stale beer and french fries and there are many alcohol induced zombie frat guys wandering around causing troubble. There is no security to speak of, I can't find a camera anywhere outside of the casino so I actually am concerned about car break-ins in the garage. I gave it a poor value because anytime you have to pay for such a poor experiance, then it is a 100% waste of money when for a little more and you can have a fine experiance without the anoyances and security concerns. Really there is no reasion to go to Hooters over Laughlin, NV or Panama City, FL in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Better off at Motel 6!”
Reviews.Author: ksd_SunGroupie
Reviews.Content: This place was a disgusting disappointment from beginning to end. The service was terrible, the food prices were outrageous for the quality, definitely not nearly as good as other Hooters I've been too. The rooms were filthy, the carpets had huge stains everywhere, I didn't even want to sit down anywhere or take my shoes off it was so bad. Oh and the pool well, I've been to motels with better pools. AND TO TOP IT ALL OFF...the girls were WAY below even decent looking...it was almost upsetting. It felt like they took the worst motel they could find and slapped the name Hooters on it and said let's see what happens when we put no money or effort into this.

Reviews.Title: “Car damage by Valid parking employee”
Reviews.Author: chinh562
Reviews.Content: I learn during stay at hooter 2 night, the room was so old, elevator slow and old barely working, Internet was charge $12.99 per day, and also my 2007 Lexus IS250 was parking by Valid Parking employee, which we found out that our car was damage..It's been over a few week but they still haven't be able to solve the problem or resolve it. Not like at Rio, Mandalay or other major casino, they qiuckly resolve any problem..

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel value near the strip”
Reviews.Author: roughnready68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times now, and I am convinced that this is the best value near the strip. The rooms are cheaper and cleaner than some of the discount hotels that sit on the strip itself. (Hooters is a short block or two away.) The downside, of course, is the name and brand of the hotel. The staff is also a little bit less professional than other places. Other than that, the rooms are well kept with nice beds. There's not much more I could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic down to earth in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: ureds123
