Reviews.Content: We have stayed in vegas three times prior to this , we decided on Hooters because of its location, south strip just minutes from the MGm Grand, New New etc etc , this hotel is a welcome bonus as its much smaller and easy to get around, the Dan Marino restaurant is excellent all you can eat buffet breakfast , virtually no queing hot lovely clean food , hooters own restaurant excellent also, nice shop poolbar and pool, great shows and bar a friendly hotel, can easily find your way around and by this i mean you can actually find your way out not like the other hotels that lose you in a maze of casinos, cleanest most comfortable bedrooms in the tower ive ever slept in,really reasonable place to stay price wise, save your dollars for shopping,shows,clubs etc. Not a pretentious snobby place at all easy to get to, would recommend, however if you want to show off and stay in 5 star luxury hey its only a bed to rest your head go ahead and be ripped off elsewhere. Hoover dam awesome, helicopter over Grand Canyon a must.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters gives you all the best of strip for less.”
Reviews.Author: cweedin
Reviews.Content: 10th trip to Vegas First stay at Hooters. It's location is really great because you only have to go through the Tropicana parking lot and you are on the strip or just cross the strip and you've got Monorail access. Price was a major factor for the stay but the soft beds will have me staying again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before-Knew what to expect but has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: kimmeeta
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hooter's 3 times over the past 3 years so we knew what to expect as far as rooms etc. Our disappointment came from the casino. Over half of the tables closed during the week. On Sat night most of them were open. We did all of our gambling on the middle of the strip. Which means we now get a week comped at our choice of 3 Harrah's properties and that is where we will be spending our next trip to Vegas. Sat out by the pool for the first time on this trip. Hot tubs very dirty. Pool with the water fall felt like ice water. Due to unforeseen circumstances my husband had to spend an extra night in Vegas and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A picture is worth a thousand”
Reviews.Author: noella041
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there our last vacation together. He was killed in a traffic accident 8 mos later and the reason i felt compelled to go back and write a review. We had an awsome time and the picture his mother used at his funeral was taken at the bar. The smile on his face let me know he had a great time and im glad we went there. The water in the rooms was kinda hot only complaint. Charming is the best way to describe it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jayball102
Reviews.Content: What most people need to remember is that this is not a mega hotel that has been built in the past 2 decades. This hotel is older and you need to keep that in mind when your staying here. We stayed on the top floor in a 2 bedroom suite. Yes it was dated but it was clean and comfortable. No complaints on the noise as some stated. This is a younger hotel so there were some roudy younger people but one could only expect that. Now the good news, I gambled here in October and played craps for several hours before flying out. Since that time ive recieved promotions to stay here. They offered me 3 nights in a suite, $100.00 food and beverage credit and $150.00 in free slot play. The food and beverage credit was great and was up $80.00 when I left the machine. I would overall say that this was a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price...pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: traveller1212_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hooters for a weekend trip and while I was a little leary at first ("you get what you pay for"), we were pleasantly surprised. We had no problem checking in early. Our room was clean (bed was really comfy) and the bathroom was clean. We spent very little time in our room anyway - after all, you are in Vegas. We ate at the Hooters restaurant one night and at The Mad Onion one dinner and 2 breakfasts. Food was fine. We received complimentary show tickets to see Todd Paul and he was HILARIOUS!! The casino is small, but we spent a lot of our time at MGM Grand (which is right across the street). The location is off the strip, but only a short 5 minute walk. We paid $33 per night for our room and I would not have done it any differently.

Reviews.Title: “NOT CLEAN - NOT EVEN WORTH THE CHEAP RATES”
Reviews.Author: jchormann
Reviews.Content: The room was very dirty, there were stains on the bedspread, the floor was stained, it smelled moldy, the bathroom was not clean. This is not a 3-star hotel. I would not recommend it, even at a cheap price. I also would not recommend this place for women traveling alone. The parking garage was dark and dirty. I would give this place 1-2 stars at best. for the same price, stay at the stratosphere instead.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was really the only good thing.”
Reviews.Author: azn_cat8
Reviews.Content: First, we didn't have a bathtub and the shower was like a locker room. Second there was one door between the 2 rooms so someone next door could have just walked in to my room! Also the walls are thin and the people next to us were really loud. The sliding door also just popped off when we went to open the door. Finally our door wouldn't lock unless we put the key in and did it our self.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: poohspal1977
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was great! Promotion was great as was the rate! Only down side was that bell hop was unaware of bus that ran from MGM Grand to Fremont St. We ended up paying $25 for a taxi to fremont but then found out about the bus for our trip back and it was $3 a person. Other than that, everything was enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Need some improvements”
Reviews.Author: jgutierrez09
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel, en general terms, that need a better maintenance program. The girls were not as friendly and not as pretty as I would expect. The bar at the pool has a schedule that didn't check with mine, so my two free drink's ticket were useless and for some reason I didn't understand, the card with the 100 to play were useless too in the only machine a tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: winedivalicious
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday early afternoon. Safe was locked when we entered our room. Call 3 times to have someone unlock it before they arrived. Tues. we had no electricity in our bathroom, (nobody did in any of the rooms directly above or below us), but the maintenance staff was awesome and kept checking on us to let us know that they were still working on it. Great, polite guys. Checked on us 3 times to make sure everything was working properly. Fixed in 1 hour. Mad Onion (formerly called Dan Marino's in 2009 when we were there) was awful. Midwesterners...don't order a steak, you'll be disappointed. They do offer 25 cent wings after midnight, but you had to be seated even to take them to go. Wait staff was very good though. The Hooter's restaurant was awesome. We ate there 4 times in a week. No wait staff at pool during the week. Get drink specials at Pete & Shortey's Bar from 3-6 p.m. Draws for $2.00. Room was fine. The comforter on the bed was old and disgusting. Dixie's Dam Bar sucked. They don't have dancers on the bar like Coyote Ugly. Very disappointing. Only 1 female bartender. Left Coyote Ugly to check out Dixie's and was definitely disappointed. Husband was upset and went to manager about it.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here sleeping in car would be better”
Reviews.Author: Tobbers
Reviews.Content: We were on the 4th floor. It was filthy. The carpet in the hallways were filthy and smelled. They were really stained badly. The elevator didn't work. I took the stairs down because only one elevator worked and the stairs took me to the 2nd floor. Couldn't figure out if they went beyond that. Some guy in the elevator had the same experience. Other guests said the same thing about it being dirty. Our room felt dirty and old. It was dirty, stuff along the carpet near the wall. The remote for TV didn't work and when we called the front desk they sent up a worker who didn't speak English and gave us another remote and that didn't work. It has a nice swimming pool but I would rather sleep in the car before I stay there again. I didn't dare walk about the room without shoes on and I'm not a picky person. There were food trays on the floor near the elevator that were still there the next day that hadn't been removed. People with room keys that couldn't get into their rooms. Awful experience. No blankets on the bed, just sheets and a bedspread. My recommendation stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe all the Negative Comments on this Place”
Reviews.Author: lforish
Reviews.Content: We experienced no problems at this casino hotel Great staff ,great pool,good enough room and great table dealers and hooters girls. We had a room in floor 9 with a great view in the "ocean view" wing. Windows were dirty and needed cleaning but overall everything was not nearly as bad as some other commenters made it out to be. No problems in the elevators like others commented. Had to ask for our promotion package after check in but received it right away when asked for. All employees we spoke to were helpful and not nasty at all.Come on for a total of $31 a night on the promotion package and the fantastic location of this casino-How can you go wrong. If you are on a budget and want to be near mgm grand location have no fear to stay here. The money saved can be used for shows or souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: lawrence454
Reviews.Content: Overall had a great time at a great value. They need to the fix elevators.

Reviews.Title: “very nice & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jelly4435
Reviews.Content: Dont believe all those negative reviews! We stayed on the 17th floor Strip view very nice & clean

Reviews.Title: “What We Expected and Nothing More”
Reviews.Author: nleazer
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable enough, but felt old and worn. The shower and sink did not drain and more than once I was afraid the toilet was going to overflow. The beds were cormfortable enough. The pool view was nice. Two of the three elevators broke at one point and everyone was forced to use just one, causing some long delays, but they got them working by the end of the evening. Reading previous reviews made us aware of what to expect, and that is what we got. Was a decent room for the price and was close to where we had plans to see.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Showers Suck”
Reviews.Author: hotshower
Reviews.Content: The stay was great, the room was clean, the bed was comfy but the hot water didn't work!!! We would certainly have liked to be able to have a hot shower in the morning before hitting the road!

Reviews.Title: “It's called hooters”
Reviews.Author: roadtrips_united
Reviews.Content: Room was as expected, but wet carpet on arrival. alarm clock broken, wasnt replaced by staff when asked in a message to front desk. safe door was broken, had to wait for it to be replaced. bathroom door broke last day and lock wouldnt open.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is a great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saftias
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel and casino were clean and colorful. The staff was friendly. My only complaint; I booked 2 bungalows, 2 monthes in advance, arrived at 7:30am and at 3:30pm was told there was only one of the two bungalows available. Your staff offered an upgrade. I asked for 2 rooms with pool view, only one had a pool view. I hope that this is a rare occurance and not the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: COBowden
Reviews.Content: I am a manager at a Hilton Hotel, and i understand things happen, so i over look a lot of things. But this was by far the worst hotel i have ever seen. My room was dirty and the faucet did not work. After an hour of witing they finaly moved me to a nother room 7 floors away from my friends. I asked for compensation, the manager Patrick said " i can give you $20. in food and beverage" I asked for an upgrade, nope. only a coupon. i asked for a free night, nope! He then told me i could talk to the manager, when she is available. I am on vacation the last thing i want to do is wait for a manager to have the time to talk to me. My husband got stuck in there elevator for 10 min. no compensation. The pool was disgusting, things were floating in it, had not bee cleaned. . . ever! the hotel was a disaster. we were there for 3 nights, on our second day, only one elevator was working! I would never stay inthis hotel again. The GM should be embarressed to eaven have guests. if i were to have this problem in my hotel, the first thing i would do is comp the room. you will give a way rooms like candy to those wou spend money but to a guest whou is haveing a major problem, sorry, so sad, to bad! Again stay away. not worth a penny of your time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: azcardinalsgrl
Reviews.Content: First off this hotel is very old. You can tell as soon as you get in the elevators. The room looked like a motel 6 room. The bed was broken, there were cigarette butts from the person before on the ground, and the shower was dirty. When we got in our room there was a bunch of plates and food outside our door with cigarettes all over it from somebody's room service. I called and asked if someone could pick it up and it was still there at 6 the next morning. I had to call again and ask to get it picked up and finally it was. The elevator didn't work half the time so we had to use the back stairs which took you outside on the other side of the building. The promotional play here is a joke. You get $100 that you have to play on selected $5 slots and you can only cash out at a certain amount of credits (I believe 1700) in which you only get $50. I could have spent $20 more a night to stay on the strip but thought this hotel would be nice and was I wrong! Do not stay here, you will be so disappointed and grossed out!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixReviewman
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation, it stated that it included 2 free breakfast buffets. When I mentioned it to the lady at the front desk, she said we didn't have any more coupons and didn't seem to care. I stopped back later when 2 new people were at the desk and they said to stop by in the morning. When I stopped by in the morning, they told me to back later in the morning it's too early. I just kept getting the run around. We ate breakfast anyway and figured I would handle it when I checked out. The breakfast was cold, even the fresh stuff they just put out! I did the express check out because the line was way to long...not sure if I was credited withthe other free buffet. The food at Hooters the night before was warm, not hot when it was brought out and greasy! I had never had this bad of wings before! I also got yelled at by the guy at the Owl Club because my 13 yr old was standing back against the wall and according to the gentlemen, he couldn't help me as long as my kid was around. I travel to Vegas often with kids because I coach hockey and have never experienced anything like this before in what I call a 1/2 star hotel! The tub was dripping all night, with rust on the tub, and the ac on low was soooooooo loud! The elevator door sometimes took 4 times before the doors would close and move! I would not recommend staying at Hooters to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Schmaa
Reviews.Content: Everyone always looked at us weird when we said we were staying at Hooters... but it was a fantastic place to stay at. The prices were the best we found, the rooms were clean and spacious, the staff was friendly. The restaurants are decently priced, which is great when you're on a budget like we were. We really enjoyed our stay there, and we will defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “You can make a request but not a reservation”
Reviews.Author: ruatraveler
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for a three night stay in a nonsmoking king room over 30 days in advance of my arrival. Upon arrival, I checked in and proceeded to a smoking king room wedged between the elevator and the parking garage. When I tried to change it, I was advised there were no nonsmoking king rooms available. When I reminded them of my reservation, they informed me that a room type is a request and they cannot guarantee a room type. After waiting over an hour, I was moved to a nonsmoking room with two queen beds and told I could move again the next night if my room preference became available. The second room had a toilet that kept running. The end of the story is that I checked out of Hooters a day early and into another hotel that effortlessly met my needs. Needless to say, with so many options in Las Vegas, I won't be staying at Hooters again.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: kellysnodCalifornia
Reviews.Content: not bad for the price eat at the wing shop real good

Reviews.Title: “I WAS DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: BILLJAXN
Reviews.Content: The desk was sticky. The carpet had spots on it. The windows were dirty. The maid service never showed up. The non-smoking room smelled of smoke. We realize that the room rates were a good value, but we would have paid twice as much to have a more hygenic environment. We left a day early because we could not enjoy the room. But we maust say that the staff in the casino and in the two reastaurants were excellent, pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is”
Reviews.Author: gurlygurl1969
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very convenient and cost effective - with that being said, the poker room is ok but definitely needs to be upgraded - I even own an automatic card shuffler.

Reviews.Title: “The hallways and room had a horrible...”
Reviews.Author: Mikeinnv
Reviews.Content: The hallways and room had a horrible odor. The carpets were stained and looked very dated. We had to come to Las Vegas on short notice and the price was good. However, you definetely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chad_Ingram
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 guys in a room at this hotel, and I must say I was pleasently surprised for the price comparative to other hotels in the area. First off the hotel is not that far off strip, and it is 1 street crossing away from MGM. We made it to Excalibur and New York New York in 2 minutes walking. We visited nearly every casino on the strip and the service from the cocktail waitresses when playing was as good as any other casino. The hotel rooms were very clean, however the "double" beds were pretty small, so if you're sharing a bed, although everything was clean, its basically a twin bed. You should probably watch out for the additional charges, because although you pay an $8.50 resort fee, internet is not wireless and costs $13 per day to use the ethernet jack. In addition to that it costs $.75 each time you make a phone call, even if its local or on a calling card. The pool area is beautiful, but the pool tends to always be bit dirty by the end of the day, however the staff is up every morning cleaning it for the next day. Its hard to fault the resort for how filthy some guets can be. Overall I would say for the price you can't go wrong, lots to do, easy access to the strip and well organized and relaxing environment

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MichWolverine2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered the basics for a basic price. The restaurant breakfast buffet provided a fair variety of good food. The overall appearance was clean, compact gaming (went elsewhere for more room) and polite employees. No coffee, fridge or micro in the room, but use of the safe was free. Found out last day could get a cup of coffee by requesting a single cup maker from housekeeping. The hotel needs some serious investment to freshen the place before I would recommend it. Carpet is worn, only one of the shower head selections worked and the tub drained very slowly (backed up). Had to request housekeeping to make up the room because they forgot (said we told them not to make up the room).

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel/Casino and Personnel all need refurbishing.”
Reviews.Author: OOOSSSUUU
Reviews.Content: Beware this hotel has additional mandatory "Resort Fee" of $7.50 plus $0.90 in tax to use a far below average Las Vegas pool.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer Service Responce from Manager, miss quoted on rates Terribly!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLaVigne
Reviews.Content: I Was to say the least Terribley Disappointed!!!!! In the Customer Service by the Manager on Duty! I spoke with (Several TIimes) as well as left a Persona Letter w/copies of Medical Emergency Surgery due to car accident where my neck was broke in 4 plc back in 2plcs RT Shoulder & Scapula Crushed. My Husbands John L Ruggles stayed with you the previous Thurs-Sun yet I was Unable to travel due to Medical Emergency at that time kept in Hospital in Michigan with Emergency Surgery on Monday,, So I rebooked with a Friend of his that was staying for Tues-Sat I Arrived Wed (Finally) Room Rates that were quoted were Not the proper charge that was disdcussed at time of booking. I had called front desk agter I lleft a Personal letter. At that time I was Assured the Manager would be in contact wtih me, I Did Was Not Contacted at All! I had dinner for the 2nd Night in a Row at the Madd Onion with Steve as my Waiter adn Flew Out at 6:10 a.m Sat Please Forward me a copy of my Invoice w/the chargers for my Room. Thank U.....Hope you had a Fabulous Easter. Jennifer Ruggles 413 N Dennis RD Ludington, MI 49431 [--] E-jenlavigne@charter.net

Reviews.Title: “Great room rate, but room could have been better”
Reviews.Author: whistleradio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on a Thursday and spent one night and two days in town. We got a great deal on the room including free breakfast for two and drinks. The room had a odd smell to it and the plumbing was bad. We ate dinner and breakfast there, the wait to be seated was no more than 15 minutes and the food was good and hot.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no Frills.”
Reviews.Author: Kamikaze_traveler
Reviews.Content: The room rate was reasonable, until you add on the extra charge for Pool, Spa, Room Safe (which didn't work) and parking. For the price, you get a bed and a bathroom. Some places have fridges or microwaves in the rooms, but here, there wasn't even a coffee maker in the room, and the coffee in the gift shop was $2.50 for a small cup. They wanted more for a days Internet access a days cost of the room. If you want to print something in the business center, you pay for an hour of Internet access ($8.95) plus 80 cents a page.

Reviews.Title: “Great, casual and friendly guests and staff... horrible food.”
Reviews.Author: klgadley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great with respect to friendliness of staff and with this being a less expensive hotel, the guests were younger and more friendly than at other hotels located on the "strip". The only bad thing I can say is that the food is absolutely horrible. I love the food at my local Hooters restaurants (LA and Orange County) but the food here was miserable, and of course, is more expensive than at other branches. I tried it two of my four-night stay and had calamari, buffalo shrimp, and wings during the two dinners... all were borderline inedible. I assumed this would be their "flagship" store and as such, I was expecting the same, if not more of a, menu than that available at my local Hooters... so wrong... Bottom line, great/fun hotel... just don't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “I can tolerate alot but this was absolutly the worst I have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: ladyAlberta
Reviews.Content: To start I booked a non smoking king bed one month ahead of time I got non smoking twin beds this was our first trip without our kids travelling with us and we get twin beds. The staff were the most unfriendly people I have ever came across in my life time of traveling. The cleaning lady would remove all the do not disturb signs in the morning and then knock and barge in every morning by 9 there were no locks to keep them out!! The hotel is run down and not clean at all. They advertise that they are a green hotel no they are not I have stayed at hotels that are and this one is not!! They advertise wireless internet no not so and only one computer could be connected unless you want to pay the big price for another computer to be plugged in to. The resort fee is a joke we never stayed at the hotel we got up and left every morning we didnt even step foot out the doors to the pool but still charged every day for that. The bottled water is only free for the first 2 bottles only after that extra charges apply. You could not see out the windows either extremly dirty. I thought when I looked at all the reviews for this place that the people were just to picky but sorry not so they were actually telling it like it is forsure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Ronbokaz
Reviews.Content: We paid on average $35 per night and it was a great bargain. This is what I would call a "standard" style hotel (not the elaborate layout you find at the big strip hotels) and it is very comfortable and clean. We had a room overlooking the pool and you could also see the jets landing/taking off from the airport which was pretty cool. Pool area is nice and they have a great gym for a hotel. We stayed 5 nights and had no complaints. It is right across the street from the MGM and a short walk to the Tropicana/Strip so it's very easy to get to the action. The Hooters restaurant had great service and other than eating too many wings no complaints. The Mad Onion $9.99 prime rib avaiable each day was also a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “just what i expected”
Reviews.Author: jockgrieve
Reviews.Content: for the price i paid i couldn't have asked for any more from the hotel, it may not be the most up to date, recently refirbished hotel in the world, but it is comfortable, clean, fun, in the best locattion in las vegas, and no one looks down thier nose at you, no matter what state you come home in.

Reviews.Title: “Price & location -Good ------the rest marginal”
Reviews.Author: skyboySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Finding the elevators was the FIRST of many disappointments. The drains in the bath & bathroom sink drained extremely slowly. We were constantly stand in dirty water taking a shower. Maintenance was called & a "repairman" was called to fix the problem-----wrong!! The drains still were cloged. After the second night my back was hurting so much I had to get another room, or change hotels. The second room we got was a marked improvement over the first. The bed was more comfortable & the drains worked properly. Based on our experience I would not recommend the Hooters if anyone was to get a room in the BAY AREA. The free breakfast, free drink & appetizers were VERY NICE. After booking & paying for the room on the internet, I did not appreciate having to pay a RESORT FEE at the hotel. THIS FEE SHOULD HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN THE TOTAL COST OF THE ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “lack of details”
Reviews.Author: mopargirl1961
Reviews.Content: there were only 2 towels in the bathroom. The first night we had fresh shampoo but after a couple of days we had to ask the maid (also asked her for a towel) but we got neither. No coffee pot? No fridge in the room. No Wfi - in this day and age how can you charge $13 per day for wifi????? Restaurant food was pretty bad. However, on a brighter note, we had a child in the next room on the weekend and the front desk moved us to a quietier room - much appreciated. Overall - good price but unlikely to stay again - the amenities are required

Reviews.Title: “Less apologizes more action...”
Reviews.Author: persophone73
Reviews.Content: I had a few complaints and had to get the manager but nothing was done after I talked to the front desk. I told the front desk immediately upon arriving in my room that the gate to the cabanas was not working. It was literally swinging in the breeze. Then I was shocked that the door into the cabanas wasn't locked either. There wasn't an officer there checking IDs or anything else to make me think this issue was taken seriously. Some other complaints I had that aren't nearly as serious were: a tray left in the hall near housekeeping closet was there for hours, floors in the bathroom were a little dirty, one of the hot tubs wasn't working ( no sign or anything, just shocking to jump into cool water) and there seemed to be a plastic cover on the bed that made it sweaty. What chocked me most was that I wasn't offered anything, not even a coupon for a discount on a meal, when I told the manager this was a second complaint. I realize this was a great deal on a room but honestly it wasn't worth what I spent.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is fun!”
Reviews.Author: the_savman
Reviews.Content: Ok, the Four Seasons it aint but what do you expect for $30?? It's in a great location right opposite MGM Grand and its a fun place to hangout in Vegas. Not recommended for romantics although I would've thought this was somewhat obvious. The rooms are nowhere neas as bad as made out, basic but fine considering you shouldn't be spending much time in them! There's on site restaurants too and 25c wings after midnight which is pretty hard to beat. All in all it's a cool place to set up base and have fun, sure you can get better for not for the price. A different way to do Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay at Hooters again, nor would I recommend it to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: triphop67
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we did not get the room we payed for. Even if we did, the windows were so dirty that we couldn't see it anyways. We ordered room service and none of the order was right. In fact, when we called to try correct the order the woman on the phone told us she put the order in right so she doesn't know what to do. When we finally get our order it's cold. The night we decide to eat in the Hotel at The famous Hooters, we order fried pickles and they are so salty! No one at the table could choke one down. When we told the waitress she simply says, "yeah I know they are gross, I can't eat them but that's how they make them and people seem to love them." Seriously? So clearly I would not stay there again and I would not recommend to any of our friends who are all in the Navy. My husband and I were looking for a nice stay after his tour in Iraq and we were left feeling unsatisfied and jipped. Like we wasted our money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: harrin22
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 4 nights. We arrived Tuesday night and they started off by saying we couldn't get a non-smoking room because it was too late. Even though we made reservations 2 months in advance! We weren't happy about this and the worker didn't care nor did he try to work something out with us. Usually places will do ANYTHING to make the customer happy. On top of that it was gross; the hallways literally smelt like gerbils & weed. We were put on the 2nd floor and took the steps one day and there was a guy passed out (they don't lock the back door) NOT SAFE!! Out of the 4 nights we stayed here our beds were only made ONCE. My friends and I said we would rather have spent the extra $100 and stayed somewhere nice...where they appreciate the fact that you're giving them business.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost, good location.”
Reviews.Author: rafaeldonadio
Reviews.Content: I recommend it for everyone. The rates are very low (during the week). The room was clean, but the smell was not so good....I've stayed in non-smoke room. The elevator from parking to get in the Hotel is terrible...Hooters must to fix it! There are a lot of powerfull lights at the hotel side, so If you plan to stay in a room (was my case) and sleep with the curtains opened....forget it....IMPOSSIBLE...to much light!!! Dont waste time at Hooters restaurant...there are a lot of better options at Strip!!!!! But this is a very good option, close to strip with low cost....

Reviews.Title: “Can I give less than one circle?”
Reviews.Author: samjluck
Reviews.Content: Spent this last weekend at this hotel and am sorely dissapointed with my overall stay. Arrived early Saturday and there were no rooms ready so simple stuff, give the bags to the bell captian and wander the strip right? When I went to the bell captians desk he was engauged in conversation with a friend, he saw me and continued his conversation and ignored me for a good 5 minutes where he finally labored over and acted as if i was bothering him to hold my bags for a few hours while the room would finished and ready. the best part - he still looked at me like "where's my tip" when he handed me the claim ticket, seriously???....... Come back at 2:30 (when we were told the room would be ready) and had to wait until 4:15 to get keys. if it was going to be 4:15 why didn't they say 4:15 and not 2:30? room was clean, no complaints at this point. number of towels is a little light for 2 people and they are very cheap and thin - that coupled with the heavy detergent used on then = room for improvement. this is a typical 20's patron hotel and when you get up in the morning and go get coffee, it is a complete crap shoot as to what will be found in the hallways and elevators. no exception this sunday morning - a big pile of pool sand or sugar int he hallway, plam tree leaves and almost completed chicken wing bones lay in wait from the room door to the elevator. nice stuff. So we leave the room/hotel sunday morning at 9:00am and get back at 6:00pm to find the room uncleaned. call house keeping - no answer, call front desk and get a girl who basically tells me "this is not my problem and you will need to talk to house keeping about that" and hung up on me!!!! seriously?????? call house keeping back and after 15 rings get someone that answers the phone. tell them what my room number is and that the room has not been cleaned and she sys she'll get it taken care of. we leave for dinner and come back expecting the room to be dirty - but the towels were swapped out and the bed was made, nothing else. so after complaining i got less than the INDUSTRY STANDARD for hotel stays. Why would I need to actually call in the first place to say "clean my room", i'm the guest. maybe at hooters casino and hotel they forgot what "guest" means?? so we check out monday morning and have a late flight and they have to hold the bags again. so again standing at the bell captians desk while a new bell jock is reading the paper and actually sighed as he put it down to get my bags after I waited again for about 5 minutes for him to finish the maraduke cartoon. again looked like "where is my tip" for moving my bag 3 feet to the big closet behind the desk. overall this is a place to stay and nothing more. the ability to do the bare minimum seems to escape the staff and the sense of entitlement for limited services rendered is way out of proportion to the services delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Staff attitude needs an adjustment”
Reviews.Author: Seven052
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for my Bachelorette party. We thought it would be fun to stay at Hooters and it's right off the strip. We got a deal. Half the outlets in one of our rooms didn't work. The staff was rude our entire stay. At one point I watched one of the Hooters girls on her way to the pool drop a chicken wing, pick it up and put it back on the plate and proceed to serve it. No shuttle service to any other hotel. When we arrived the baggage service was backed-up an hour and a half, so we had to carry all of our bags up to the rooms. We asked for a coffee pot in the morning and they wouldn't give us more then 2 servings of coffee, although we had 8 in our party between the 2 rooms. The ironing board was broken, and it took probably an hour to get a new one. The walls were paper thin; you could hear whole conversations in the next room. Their "free play" promo is idiotic. $100 in free play for everyone in our party, however you have to play on selected machines, and you can't cash any winnings out until you reach an absurd minimum. When we first sat down to play, there was a couple who hit it big when they first came in, but because they had not won the 2000 credit minimum they were stuck there for 2 hours just trying to play it out so they could leave. They asked if I wanted to take over their machine so they could go. I said sure and as soon as they left the attendant came over and cleared all the credits out. I understand it may have been hotel policy, but she was very rude. We went to cash in our Hooters cards before we left, and the guy was like a line nazi. "ONLY 2 PEOPLE AT THE COUNTER." Stay somewhere else. This was the worst hotel/casino experience I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “I am glad it was free!”
Reviews.Author: disonhood
Reviews.Content: I recieved a 3 night stay at this hotel because my first experience was so awful. I am so glad that I did not pay for this second stay because it was just as disappointing as the first. Rooms are disgusting, stains on both comforters, and tidy service was very minimal. They simply made the beds and left. Staff is mostly unfriendly. Bell desk was rude and wouldn't even come to pick up our dry cleaning, we had to drop it off and pick it up at the desk. I guess they don't like tips! Hooters girls serving drinks on the casino floor were rude to me and my sisters. You have to be a male to get service. My fiance had to order my drink in order for me to get one! There is no wireless internet in the entire hotel. The front desk was the only bright smiling face in the whole place, and that only went for when we checked in, not out. The best part of the hotel is that they serve Hooters wings and those are incredible! However, not worth paying for a room there. I would never stay there again, even if it was free!

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing experience!! :(”
Reviews.Author: porcelindoll22
Reviews.Content: We are from San Diego, and always enjoy visitng the Hooters downtown, we thought it would be a great idea to stay at Hooters in Las Vegas?? When we were parking the car, the elevators from the 5th floor parking structure were extremely filthy!! Upon check in the gal behind the counter was not to friendly(just doing her job)???? As we sat at the bar at the entrance the Hooter girls looked nothing like a "Hooter Girls"!!! Not to friendly either!! The hotel room had stains on the carpet, a bath tub that did not drain very well, and a dirty toilet!!!! Nedless to say we were very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Big Wins”
Reviews.Author: Chislotgirl
Reviews.Content: I really like Hooter, I had four total rooms for 7 family mamebers. Small enough to always find people when in the casino. Rooms could be cleaner. Had fun at Purple Reign, Food is always ok not something to write home about. Staff is always friendly. Great value and a nice central area to be able to take avantatge of other areas in Vegas, And I won enough to go home a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: polish_princess82
Reviews.Content: First off, we booked and paid for a bungalow room and ended up in a regular tower room which is an "upgrade" . And lets not even get started on the view from our room. Ugh. We ate the overpriced Mad Onion, it was certainly nothing special. When we actually ate at the Hooters restaurant, my plate of hot wings was slammed down in front of me. I sent the hot wings back because they tasted and smelled horrible! We thought we were saving money by staying here but by the time they tack on their resort fee, well lets just say,spend your money elsewhere. We will never ever go back to Hooters for any reason. Not to eat, not to stay and not to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Hoot Hoot!”
Reviews.Author: SGrizwade
Reviews.Content: What can you say about Hooters Hotel & Casino? If you've ever been to a Hooters restaurant/bar, then you only have to imagine that you're staying in a room upstairs, there's a pool out back, that you can gamble 24/7 and that chicken wings are only 25c (after 12pm). This isn't the Bellagio, Paris or the Venetian - if you're looking for something like that then book one of them. It isn't plush or swish, it's simply Hooters - at it's best. Service and friendliness of staff was exceptional. Location is excellent. If you want to do Vegas in party style, without a mega budget, go to Hooters. You'll have a Hoot!

Reviews.Title: “March Madness Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jwichelt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hooters with a couple buddies of mine over March Madness. The Hotel rate was very low and that was an overall deciding factor. The beds in the rooms were OK but the bathrooms could use some attention as they didn't seem the cleanest. But this was OK for a couple guys! The Hooters girls were mostly friendly and the food was surprisingly good. There could have been more room to sit and eat rather than a machine everywhere you sit. The Sports Book is small but sufficient. Overall had a good time and rated this right about for the amount we spent. A good value for what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: hogn99
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price and location. However, you have to add it all up. $8 dollars per day for resort fee changes the 'daily rate' a decent amount. $38 for a decent room is not bad, but tax and resort rate put you around $50. The main down side is the internet - $13 per day. The breakfast buffet is pretty good and you get two for free. Otherwise it's $10, so you have to weigh it against perks at $60 hotels. Garage and elevator are nasty. But inside the hotel is pretty nice. If you just need a place to crash and a pool to hang out at, this is a great place for cheap. Five minute walk to New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: bizrisky
Reviews.Content: Hooters always has a great casual atmosphere. The place was hopping with lots of young people around during the spring break. We especially enjoyed the outdoor pool area, heated pool, sunshine, cheap beer! The restaurant was good, not exceptional, but good with some great deals ($10 prime rib dinner). The king bed was excellent and the room was large. The place does show a bit of wear and tear with some carpet stains, etc but about what I would expect for the price paid. We had a clogged sink and the battery ran down in the room safe. 2 people came up within 15 minutes of calling to fix the problems, excellent quick service given that it was late evening.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: travlngal
Reviews.Content: Beat up elevators, smelly halls, dull grimy carpet, filthy windows (in the first room AND the one I then changed to). Otherwise okay. Cheap, but the only good thing is it's location. Boulder Station is cheap AND good, though further out.

Reviews.Title: “oh my god never again!”
Reviews.Author: rebelhoots
Reviews.Content: where do i start? being a hooter's girl myself, i was expecting service with a small, beauiful women, and some cleanliness. Boy was i wrong, it was dirty and smelled of vomit. the two days i stayed there i saw maybe 5 girls and they werent that friendly. i was sad, i take pride in the job i do hoping for repeat customers and i don't feel like these girls cared at all. sad sad sad. time for the hooters casino to update the building and re-evalute the girls service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: cdparks
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping needs to be re-trained. Hotel Lobby Employees and security were wonderful!! Room felt dirty. Food at Mad Onion was Yummy!! Loved the feel of the bungalows and being able to walk right out to the pool. Very Handicap Friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rms in Tower, fun ,casual atmosphere,nice pool area.”
Reviews.Author: Winnie037
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the heated pool and Hot tub.Skip The Dam B ar Get a room in the Tower

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: CareyAO
Reviews.Content: I will just list the problems I experienced. Bathroom sink drain plugged it was fixed the second day of my stay. 2. pool deck cleaning started at 5:00 am with a gas engine pressure washer. 3. Party dude's loud all night in pool till 4:00 am. 4. Video poker wiped me out real quick, short play time with no wins. They could have kept me playing a little longer and then wipe me out.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsatisfied.”
Reviews.Author: kickboxchick
Reviews.Content: When making a final decision on where to stay for the first part of our vacation we were looking for a place with a reasonable price. So instead of staying at the Luxor we chose to stay at hooters to save about 75 dollars. I am a frequent customer at our local hooters and always received excellent service so I figure the hotel would be the same. Our first 2 nights there were fine, nothing special. But on our last night, the room next to us was out of control. First we heard everything they were doing, assuming they were having a party then came to realize it was their tv. This went on for hours we called security, they said they would take care of it, nothign happened. We called again, nothing happened. Finally so fed up we went down to the front desk, the guy was a complete jerk. Told us if it was really "such a big deal" we could change rooms. however no where NEAR the rest of our party. So we decided to stay seeing as how it was already almost 4. The guy assured us security would take care of the room next to us. We went back to our room waited about 30 minutes still NOTHING. Our cousins were staying in the room on the other side of this guy and they called security and the room across the hall called security so finally about 4:30 the tv was turned down a bit. It was still very loud but much better.In all fairness it wasnt the hotel making it an awful night, but they did nothing at all to solve the problem. The service was awful, I have never been so dissatisfied with a hotel in all the trips I have made to Las Vegas. I will never stay at hooters again nor will I eat at the restaurant , and everyone in our party feels the same way. I also would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great value/place with one super shining star”
Reviews.Author: recodjvery
Reviews.Content: The casino was nice, Food very good. Comedy show was funny. I wish they would of opened up another 3 dollar 21 table but the other tables were fun, You have one employee that cemented our return, She works the registration counter, Her name was heather, I don't think we've ever met a more helpful person. Our room we book wasn't ready, She took our number and called us with options as they opened. Then after the first night we decided we wanted a pool side room as she made it happen with a quickness. Great attitude, Left us feeling like if I needed anything to make the stay better it would happen. All in All we are looking forward to our next trip and will book with you again with out thought. Sincerely Louis & Dena Thune

Reviews.Title: “front desk help great house keeping horrible”
Reviews.Author: justinraiders
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i stayed there for three days and its truly you get what you pay for always check the sheets and your room out before settling its a nice hotel just houskeeping sucks at keeping it up. but the front desk was great at fixing the problem probabaly wont stay there again but the pool area was nice to and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Have your shower in the pool area--much better than in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain2011
Reviews.Content: All in all, good value for the money--i dont rate it high but at the time was among the bestvalue with drink and breakfast buffet coupons. Resort fee is outrageous--ad it to the cost of your room before you evaluate your cost. Their website gave a total cost, but this changed when i arrived at hotel, as the tax and resort fee was not included in the TOTAL cost quoted on website. Nice pool area and small gym has good weight machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: MyraW
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great food. The pool is awesome! The gym is great, not very big, but good selection of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: JennyTDJ
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Hooters when in Vegas. It's inexpensive and close to the action. Not to mention a 24 hour pool and hot tub AND $3 black jack.

Reviews.Title: “Sad & Sleazy & Dirt Cheap - But What Else Would You Expect?”
Reviews.Author: Metaleech
Reviews.Content: I had a 7-hour layover in Vegas en route to LA, and so chose Hooters Casino Hotel for three reasons: (1) proximity to the airport, (2) a very inexpensive room and (3) the anticipated fun of the Hooters brand. The hotel delivered on the first two criteria but massively failed me on the third, although failure was in fact part of my expectation for the brand. I'm not a fan of Hooters Restaurants (I find them misogynistic and crude) but I was quite happy to go with the flow if their was tangible enthusiasm on their side. In spite of my theoretical contempt for their misogyny, I'm not above a little flirtation and titillation, and especially at the end of a long tiring flight. Well, what a disappointment. I expected a buxom cute Front Desk staffer; instead, I got a sullen, bored, going-through-the-motions staffer not even dressed in the Hooters Girls uniform. She couldn't have been less interested in me or my stay, and seemed extremely irritated by the bother of having to check me in. And at a $32 room rate, I guess I could understand that - but no excuse. My online booking was supposed to come with $x of free slots chips and two free beers at the bar, but when I asked for them I was flatly denied, and after a long trans-continental flight and no real passion for gambling anyway, I didn't bother to press the point. Walking through the casino to the elevators was an exercise in sociological depression, looking at all the sad, marginalized, white trash patrons trying to convince themselves they were living some down-market version of the Vegas dream. And nowhere was there any evidence of the Hooters brand I was looking for: only 2 Hooters Girls waitresses did I see (neither of them buxom!) and none of the irrepressible, irreverent attitude that's supposed to make this place fun in spite of all the political incorrectness against which they rail. In a way, it was precisely what I was expecting: sad, sleazy, depressing, and dirt cheap: I slept for 5 years (the room was comfortable enough but felt like it was at the end of a shuttle to Mars it felt so far away and isolated), and then got the hell out. On my way out, the same girl who checked me in was still on shift when I checked out, and her attitude had not improved (nor her memory as she apparently had zero recollection of me checking in 6 hours earlier). In summary: to expand your horizons (downwards) for a cheap-as-chips alternative to sleeping on an airport bench, Hooters will give you a clean-enough bed close to the airport ($32, you can't go wrong for mere shelter); for anything, anything else in Vegas - you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “See for yourself”
Reviews.Author: bkdyer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there often but the room we received needed repairs. The counter in the bathroom looked like it was falling off the wall. tub dripped. mold around tub. closet door was broken. This room was sad. This was the first time I have complained about the hotel other times it was great. I will recommend to stay there but not in the bungalows.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place and location”
Reviews.Author: SeaEagle100
Reviews.Content: The location of Hooters Hotel and Cassino is right on the strip. Near by great Hotels and Casinos such as MGM, New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Bellagio, Paris and others. I stopped in Vegas for 04 days, I had a great time. The hotel is a good place to stay, clean, the staff are nice I aked to change for a room far from the elevators and they right away set up another room for me. You also have the Hooters restaurant or if you are looking for something else than chicken wings, you haver also another restaurant classy with great deal on meals, I had the Prime RIb for 9,95...You can bit that. I will stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GandRCarpinteria
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! We haven't been to Las Vegas on a Friday/Saturday since 1993, due to our jobs. (Our days off are Thursday & Friday.) We found this hotel an excellent value, and will definately stay here again, but maybe during the week! Greg & Ruth Bevington

Reviews.Title: “Hooter's Hotel and Csino has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: Yarnydog
Reviews.Content: When Hooter's first opened we loved it. It was comfortable, affordable, and clean and fun. Since then it has gone nothing but downhill. The place hasn't been kept up what so ever. it's filthy, the restuarnat booths are falling apart at the Mad Onion. (I'd be mad too!) the floor has big chunks out of it on the casino floor. the carpets are filthy, the basebaords are falling apart, etc, etc, etc.! It's too bad they have not maintained it. What a dump now!

Reviews.Title: “VERY Happy”
Reviews.Author: Mich2too
Reviews.Content: My husband has MS and required a fridge to keep him medication cold and a bed of his own due to muscle fatige and pain. Was concerned that these needs not being met would be an issue as reservations on room types is not garanteed any where in Vegas. Found that Hooters was the only hotel / casino to list their casino hosts on their web page. So we took advantage of this information and contacted not only the hotel manager but also casino host Faye Able. Faye responded almost immedicately (other hotel / casinos took weeks to reply) and promised to make everything happen for us. A quick note to her the day before our trip served as the reminder she asked for. Room was comfortable and accommodating with rustic tropical wood decor. Beds were soft yet firm. Pillows allowed for comfort while sleeping and for propping oneself up to watch TV. Our strip view was fantastic! Had views from Mandalay Bay to New York New York. Daily maid service made sure we remained comfortable our entire stay. We even extended our stay by one night. Concierge was very successful in ordering us a second scooter from Las Vegas Scooters which enabled me to keep up with my hubby. Our request was called in to concierge at 7:30 AM or so and we received the scooter at 10 AM. Mad Onion restaurant for breakfast buffet was decent. A bit simple compared to others at larger locations, but included good quality basics. Eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, biscuits and sausage gravy, fruits and pastries. We came back for dinner one night and actually ordered from breakfast menu. Good filling food. We never went away hungry or disappointed. Hubby never did get a seat at BJ table, but there were plenty of slot machines for him to occupy his time in the evenings. Todd Paul show was good. Room was cold, but entertainment was good. He offered a meet and greet with photo ops as guests left the lounge. Don't know if we would have paid to see his show if it had not been included with our stay as we've never heard of him before. (Sheltered lives...maybe) Decent location just a bit east of the strip near the south end of the "main strip" area. Very close to airport runways, but noise was never an issue in our room. Did hear them a few times while watching take offs while waiting for elevators. But nothing that would be a deal breaker. All staff made these midwest, blue collar workers feel at home and were ready to meet any of our needs when requested. Was hubby's first visit to Vegas and my second.

Reviews.Title: “I've been a Hooters regular for years and will continue to do so”
Reviews.Author: 2bigguns
Reviews.Content: The service was great! As usual. The room was fine. I maybe should have requested a non smoking room when I booked my reservation, but it was warm enough to open the window. Unfortunately it's always hard to find a blackjack table open and instead of waiting around I just went across the street. Fortunately it's not too far to the strip. I've always been a big fan of the Hooters girls, Gigi and Nikki are two of the best. Mays always been great at the tables too. After staying there so many times now it's nice that the employees remember and aknowledge me. It was also nice to finally meet Donovan. She's a very nice lady! My least favorite part of my stay would be not being able to find a table open. I have recommended HHC to many others who have stayed there and they also have been happy with the value and service. Thanks for another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money spent”
Reviews.Author: beanboy2000
Reviews.Content: hotel is getting a little run down visibility wise but when you are spending only $30 a night you can't complain. Beds are comfortable and shwoer water is hot!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: cannlee
Reviews.Content: The casino area was fine and the room was clean however the hallways and elevator areas where dirty and stained. Also the elevators where very noisy and sounded like they would break at any time. The shows were good and the Mad Onion was OK. Overall, if you cleaned up the hallways and elevators it would not be bad place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wings...”
Reviews.Author: HaveCameraWillTravel
Reviews.Content: I chose Hooters because it was directly across the street from the MGM/convention, the price, and of course, I love the wings. The parking lot was easy to get in and out of, and very close to the lobby. The check-in process was slow. The staff at the desk appeared personable, except for my clerk, who perhaps was having a bad day. I did not receive any discount coupons for drinks or breakfast (as mentioned in differnt reviews)....and then there's the "Resort Fee", although it wasn't hidden, it's nothing more than a bs fee - it covers two bottles of water per stay, local calls, and use of the pool...and it's mandatory. My room was on the 18th floor. The elevators were swift, and I hardly ever had to wait. The common areas, and hallways could use new carpet. My room was not what I would expect at Ceasars or the Hardrock, but it was big, clean, and delightfully tacky. And the view was spectacular...I could see from Mandalay Bay to New York, NY and beyond. Oh, and I slept great every night. No ambient noise to contend with. All in all I liked Hooters. It was comfortable with laid back southern charm. For the most part the staff was friendly and hospitable. If the convention was held near here again, I would definately stay here.......and reccomend it too. I like prefer smaller facilities over the mega resorts near by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: goakes
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, beds were very comfortable. A few worn and stained areas on the carpet and the sink drained a little slow but the price was phenomenal! I'll be back next year and will tell all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hooterific!”
Reviews.Author: bostonenglish
Reviews.Content: Hooters Hotel and Casino is located a block from the main Las Vegas strip and was great from the moment we stepped in! The desk staff were attentive and knowledgeable about services. The rooms were super clean!! and very roomy. Basic toiletries were provided and were of good quality. The casino was small but had all the games and slot machines all the larger casinos do. It was a little cold for the pool in February but the hot tub was great!! The only thing that could be improved was the parking, with all the people using the casino it didn't leave many spaces for hotel guests. Great room and amenities for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms in a good location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: jktraveller55
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is small, it had the necessary amenities. I needed to be near the MGM Grand for a convention, but didn't want to pay the price, so this was an easy walk across the street. The free happy hour and free first drink each night was a nice touch and the free tickets to the show was unexpected. While it was a small group at the show on a Monday, the show itself was really quite good. The magician/juggler/musician/comedian was laugh-out-loud funny and talented. The rooms were clean and comfortable - the bathroom was clean but could use an update. The first impression that needs to be fixed is the carpeting in the hallways. They look old and worn and musky in spots. Fortunately, the rooms are fine, but stepping off the elevator the first time made me wonder if I had made a correct choice in hotels. The rates are great - especially when you add the location, free happy hour drinks and free show. And the Hooter girls add a little spice to the mix.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: robnlong
Reviews.Content: Fun hotel, know about Hooters before booking! Car park arrival was dim with poorly maintained parking areas, however, check in was easy, rooms massive, view great and great value - which is why I booked. Directly opposite MGM Grand, location is good. Slept well despite polyester bedding covers, beds and nice white sheets very good. I would recommend for short value stays - after all you spend time in the Casino's that is great in Hooters. And the Chicken wings at 25c! Have a good time - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Bunch of fun”
Reviews.Author: jjallan
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Is a great place for the ladies all kinds of guys to choose from

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value”
Reviews.Author: Lunafarm
Reviews.Content: Very nice for a discount price. Plan to stay the next time in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino, Miserable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missanthropy15
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from four days in Vegas. Spent 2 nights at the Trump Tower in a 1 bedroom suite for 150/night and wanted to stay one night at Hooters just for the fun of it, since we like the Casino there and love the wings. What a mistake. Upon checking in, we were told by the front desk staff that the room we were booked in was 'old and run down' and they suggested that we upgrade. We had prepaid 40.00 for a regular bungalow room. I asked what the cost would be to upgrade and was quoted that a nicer room in the tower would be 75.00. I specifically asked if the total cost of the room would be 75.00, or if that was the cost in addition to what we had already paid. I was told that 75.00 was the total cost for the room, which was a suite. I agreed to the upgrade and we went up to the room. Please know that I understand that this is a 3 star hotel and that the theme of the hotel is 'Delightfully tacky yet unrefined'. We were ready for some intentionally bad decor. What we were not ready for was the poor state of repair that the room was in, tacky decor aside, the hideously outdated bathrooms with linoleum peeling up from the floors and the complete lack of service or regard from the staff. When we arrived in our room, I immediately called housekeeping to ask for extra blankets. I was advised that there were no clean blankets available for delivery and that they were all currently being washed. I told the rather unfriendly housekeeping representative that anything would do, a blanket or a comforter or even some extra sheets, and she still insisted that there was nothing clean in the entire hotel that she could bring me. Really? Three hours later, there was a banging on the door and when I opened it, there lying on the floor outside of the door was a rolled up comforter. I should also note that as a part of our reservation package, we were supposed to get free breakfast coupons. We didn't get the coupons and when I asked about them I was advised that the promotion was no longer going on, even though I booked this room last week. Upon check out, I was shocked to be presented with a bill for almost 100.00. I asked what the charges were for and was advised that the upgrade fee was 75.00. I explained that I had been told that the entire cost of the room was 75.00 and the 40.00 I had already paid would be applied to that. The girl just shook her head at me and stared past me as if I wasn't even there and said 'No, the upgrade was 75.00 on top of what you already paid." I asked to speak to a manager and was advised that there was no one available. I imagine they must have been washing blankets or something. In summary, I would never ever in my life stay at this hotel again. Ultimately, I shelled out 115.00 to stay in a 'suite' at a 3 star hotel with bad dirty carpet, hideously old and decrepit bathrooms and some of the worst service I have ever experienced. Shocking, considering I had just spent 2 nights in a one bedroom suite at the Trump for 150.00 per night with an enormous marble bathroom, stunning decor, a full kitchen and was treated like royalty. There is nothing delightfully tacky about this piece of crap hotel. Come for the wings and the casino, and then leave. *Business travelers beware: You are charged a resort fee at this hotel, but it does not include internet service. There is a separate charge for internet use. This is just bad form.

Reviews.Title: “I was EXTREMELY disappointed with the service and attitude at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MN-Traveler92
Reviews.Content: We knew what to expect for the location of this hotel. We also weren't expecting much as far as amenities since we were paying $100 for a 3 night stay. We had also visited this casino for lunch on past occasions. What we weren't expecting was the horrible service and maintenance around the hotel. There were stains in the carpet of our room, it looked like at least one of wall of the bathroom had been repainted, but no one even bothered to tape off the fixtures on the wall so that there was paint on everything. My husband was playing blackjack around 7:30 am the morning of March 1st and there was an extremely drunk, rude man playing who was abusing the dealer. Instead of asking the man politely to leave, the pit boss took the side of the man calling his dealer vulgar names. The two times we tried to be seated in the Mad Onion we could hardly get anyone to seat us. We were seated late at night after a 5 minute wait when there was only one other table occupied. The next morning for breakfast, there were twenty people in line waiting to be seated without the restaurant being full. We waited in this line 15 minutes before we decided we would eat somewhere else. We collected our belongings from our room and checked out two days early. No one even asked why we were checking out early. It felt like all of the employees thought they only had a week left before they were out of jobs and didn't know if their paychecks would be good. No one cared....about anything.... It was not a good atmosphere. As a travel agent, I know that good service goes a long way to overcoming the rest of the travel experience. We would have stayed, regardless of location and general run down appearance of the hotel, but we couldn't deal with the lack of work ethic.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: PDM1Saskatoon
Reviews.Content: Thanks for everything! We had a wonderful time. The staff was friendly and helpfull, and they helped us learn about a new game ( craps ), which we had lots of fun with. We will be back! Pat from Saskatoon

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for!!!”
Reviews.Author: irmacv
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for... I mean its no where close to the Venetian or its not remotely close to other hotels such as Luxor or Planet Hollywood. The Casino is small and lonely, the rooms are OK in size and looks but you can hear the water pipes all night long and for some reason you DON'T get that clean feeling. It looked like an OVER-RATED-BAR with rooms to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Priced right”
Reviews.Author: TheT1Man
Reviews.Content: It was an interesting place. The staff were friendly, the room was clean, but parts of the hotel were really ragged. The carpeting in the halls needed replaced years ago, but the room itself was very clean

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Disgusting, Dilapidated, Overpriced.............”
Reviews.Author: RockNdaNard
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a very simple guy, I travel alot and have stayed in some real "interesting places" in Vegas as well as the U.S. , But Hooters has fallen from Mediocracy! This place has went seriously down hill (since my last visit 3 years ago). My room, 4th floor, had too many thing wrong to list (I even took pictures) The worst was all of the plaster and paint peeling off the walls! Phone broken, black stained bath, soiled rugs glass door doesnt lock (watch your small kids), one towel, dirty dirty, I am not a fancy guy by any means, but this was horrible! the fake wood flooring in the casino is peeling up, large cracks in it, the flooring literally slides and pops up and down when you walk on it! (ladies be careful when wearing heels in this casino) Lady who checked me in didn’t give me my entire package of bonuses, I asked her for a room somewhat close to the elevator, she said "sure it’s real close"....It was the second farthest room away from the elevator! (Ocean View Tower) The ice/Pepsi Vending area in my hallway was leaking (about 10 feet of carpet was saturated, of which nothing was fixed/dried during my stay). The graphics on the elevator door were partly ripped off. Ohh I can’t forget the fight that broke out at the registration desk between to people checking in and as I was leaving I decided to use one of the two casino bathrooms but was blocked by two Las Vegas Police officers and some yellow caution tape. Apparently "something" had happened in the bathroom and it was closed. The only real nice things that we experienced here was the excellent wait staff in the Dixey Bar and a fantastic Prime Rib Sandwich in the Mad Onion.

Reviews.Title: “the weekends was perfect and wish it didnt end.”
Reviews.Author: deeperez1013
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at hooters the staff was very nice we would love to stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: shericeb
Reviews.Content: You have amazing customer service, even down to the Security Guards. Whenever I go to Vegas, I have a problem with getting carded over and over again, I didn't have this issue at Hooters. It's great that you guys give out wrist bands. Also, the waitresses were amazing and the fact that the hot tub stays open all night was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LaHotdog69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hooters many times and enjoyed it very much. This time I found the rooms to be not as nice as I have experienced before. I say rooms because the first two rooms offered to me were in poor condition and I had to have them changed. Please do not let the hotel become a place I would not want to stay because it has always been my favorite. The service and fun in the casino was still good.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment, worst Hooters is the country per locals”
Reviews.Author: justmeohseven
Reviews.Content: When talking with the locals, one said that this was "The worst Hooters in the country" and I agree. This was the worst experience I have ever had when visiting Vegas. The water on the fourth floor was cold and was lucky on the last day of my stay to have a luke warm shower. I did inform guest services about the problems and was told they would look into it but obviously was not a HUGE concern to staff. The restaurant was nothing to write home about. The food was terrible and the service wasn't much bettter. Service throughout the hotel in general was BAD. The beds were sunken in and had to be at least 25 years old and the box springs were coming apart/ This hotel was definately not worth $135.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Sleazy and Scuzzy”
Reviews.Author: James47
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. So much to say, so little space. Check in about 4 on a Friday. Think they'd have a full reception desk? Nope. One guy. 15-20 min just to get to the desk. He was rude and abrupt. Off to the room, the elevator for which was hard to find. This place has deferred maintenance way too long. Creaky elevators, dirty floors, walls badly in need of complaint. Room heater/air conditioner rattled and clanked the whole time. Maid was very rude and grouchy when I asked for extra towels (2 towels for 2 people isn't much). Never anybody at the Bell Capt/Concierge desk. Want to print out your airline boarding pass? No problem, just go to the computer terminal by the bar and pay $5-to print out a pass? Give me a break. Forget the noise complaints-this is Vegas and people just party a lot. No problem, but this place is dirty, run down, and awful. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ddsmith100
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for my daughter's National's cheer competition. We booked 2 rooms and only paid $174 for each room for four nights. The rate was far better than any other hotel we compared. The main complaint was that the rooms are rather tired looking to say the least. Somebody in the next room smoked cigarettes and pot which filled our room so bad that it smelled like they were in our room. Opening the sliding door didn't help because the fried food smell coming up from the restaurants was almost worse. My daughter's room was across the hall overlooking the pool area which is beautiful but you get the same greasy smell on that side and there was really no escaping it day & night. The hall way flooded so they were trying to dry the carpet for 2 days but it was obviously not the first time based on the incredibly sour smell that it created. The hotel is 1 block off the strip and is an easy walk to get to the other sites. The $10 prime rib dinner is very good but the rooms really do need a little help. The house keepers were wonderful but there is only so much they can do. If I were to recommend the hotel to anybody I would be very clear about what they were getting and I certainly wouldn't recommend it to my mother, if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters”
Reviews.Author: MsCali777
Reviews.Content: Nice Rates, walking distance to the strip. Nice sized pool with an outside bar

Reviews.Title: “watch out”
Reviews.Author: queensheep
Reviews.Content: i stayed at hooters and as i went to check out i was told there was a 8.50 fee a night per room . we had no idea of it. i think everyone should be told up front about the fee.ive read alot of reviews about hooters and 48 out of 50 we not good. we had no problems except the fees.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Easy012
Reviews.Content: My wife had a good time and enjoyed our stay with Hooters very much. My only complaint is I had the breakfast buffet at the Mad Onion. Every item I tried was cold, when I mentioned this to the waitress she checked with the person who was doing the buffett and was told everything was working OK. I know that buffets are not easy to do and keep items hot but I expected them to be at least warm. Some of the bartenders seemed to be more concerned with visiting instead of taking care of the patrons. Thank you, Larry Clark

Reviews.Title: “good rate”
Reviews.Author: masasgu
Reviews.Content: I'm bringing my guest through my business therefore If I could get something special, it is more easier to satisfy my customers.

Reviews.Title: “The little secret of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kisslev
Reviews.Content: The only qualm I have with Hooter is the fact that you charge facility fee that includes swimming in winter. You could have made a gesture and provided a substitute option, equal in value, that would have won the hearts of your guests. Why, in the world, a seventy five old lady would care to use your weights room, especialy if she has arthritis. Think about it, a 15 min internet time, for instance, to check for mail and important messeges would have done wonder to your "out of the box" image. Thanx, and Best of Wishes

Reviews.Title: “I would love to return”
Reviews.Author: herculesdesonora
Reviews.Content: The rooms were simple but clean. The staff went out of their way to accomadate me. I travel 4 times a year to Vegas and I am going to consider Hooters my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “I'm never going there again.”
Reviews.Author: langbergc
Reviews.Content: First the nights where horrible..drunk people screaming out side my door both nights and then i had to pay more for the rooms that they told me..so i'm never going there again and i'm not going to recomended to my friends actually i'm going to tell them the truth.

Reviews.Title: “stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JakeW3
Reviews.Content: very fun and enjoyable, everyone was so friendly, the reseraunts were great, the hosts and hostesses were very helpful, the cost was compatable with the other hotels in the area , the hotel is right there on the strip close to the airport ,i stay there again if i had a chance

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "resort fee" added to your bill after reserving!”
Reviews.Author: rolfline
Reviews.Content: On checking in, the bill had an $8.50 resort fee added on which was never mentioned on the booking engine. I hate deceptive practices like that! The room was OK. Probably worth what we paid anyway. Negatives were the water didn't drain out of the old tub. Stained and old bathroom floor. Too soft beds with comfortors that slid off. Positives, cheap yet quiet. Just a place to sleep, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service, unclean bathrooms - blood on the door frame!”
Reviews.Author: Casey L
Reviews.Content: While cheap and close to the Strip, this place is a nightmare. We weren't allowed to check into the room until 4 PM, the concierge took 20 minutes to even show up at his desk to take our bags, the bathroom was dirty and had zero hot water, room service that took 2 hours to arrive (and the food was terrible), the bed was uncomfortable, and the highlight - blood on the bathroom door frame. Hotel staff was ZERO receptive to our complaints. This is truly the Las Vegas Hotel from Hell.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bert14
Reviews.Content: I will start with the staff was friendly - from there I was rather let down. I would rate the establishment at just above a stay at a motel 6. The housekeeping service started at 8:45 and continuously knocked until I got up to ask them to come back later - guess I would recommend using the "do not disturb sign". The food was far from any Hooters restaurant I have eaten at. The overall look and feel of the hotel and rooms was a let down in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “disappoited”
Reviews.Author: LILRAM78
Reviews.Content: i got a cheap rate but i didnt anticipate a cheap room (motel 6 come to mind). i could see light from room next door. paint in bathroom was pealing, fawcett was leaking. loud from airport and a/c. no coffee pot or wireless internet (was willing to pay but with a cord was limited to the desk without a chair.

Reviews.Title: “A quick fun getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Mpoki
